So if you want to watch a particular movie, you have to guess and keep opening movies until you find the one you want.  I asked Mayday for help and they said it's not possible to do it any differently.  This may be the straw that breaks the camel's back for me.  I may be returning it for the iPad (in which you can just import anything into iTunes) if I can't figure out a way around this.  Downgraded to 3 stars, feedback given to Mayday.***Update #2: I downloaded a program called ES3 which allows you to copy files to the HDX and you can sort them however you want.  Some movies won't play (it seems to be the ones purchased through iTunes) but I've been satisfied enough with this program that I didn't return the HDX.  And they have added a "Cloud Collections" function to the HDX finally.Now that these issues are resolved, I'm really giving it 4.5 stars, and the only reason for the 1/2 point deduction is because it is just not nearly as easy and streamlined as the iPad in terms of watching movies and listening to music.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as the Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Clyde Layton
Reviews.Content: When they upgraded and downgraded the Kindle Fire HDX they removed the mini HDMI. This was one of the reasons I got the Kindle Fire HD was because of the HDMI connectivity to my TV. I could stream the movies and Amazon Prime from my Kindle to the TV. Now with the HDX I no longer have that ability. Might as well just get a Kindle e reader now. I will probable shelf this one and continue to use the HD. What were they thinking? The reason to upgrade to a newer device is more functionality not less. Their Product Management Team need a demerit.UPDATESpent about another $70 on this. Bought the Netgear Push2TV (From Amazon). Suppose to be Certified to work with the Kindle. I have issues with the picture pixelating. I would not recommend this Kindle. If you want a great Kindle get the Kindle Fire HD not the HDX. The HD2 is suppose to do mirroring and has the HDMI connection. The HDX seems to be a way for Amazon to separate you from your money. This is a shame as I really like Amazon and am a frequent customer. I also really like the Kindle HD and would recommend it to anyone. Again the Product Management Team really messed up on the HDX.

Reviews.Title: 3rd Kindle a charm.
Reviews.Author: J&B; Reviews
Reviews.Content: I got a $50 promotion for using my Amazon Card. This deal made it possible to get my HDX 8.9 before Christmas. In typical Amazon fashion they under promised and over delivered. The item was listed to be delivered on 12/24 but was at my door 12/19. What an awesome device and design. This is my third Kindle and I was not sure I would be as impressed as I was when I got my HD 8.9 last year. The mayday button and new design were the deal breaker. Just one comment about the one star reviews of this product. 75% are complaining about the lack of Google Play store which Amazon has never supported in their Fire Generations so please SHUT UP and buy a Nexus.

Reviews.Title: much more more good than bad
Reviews.Author: dremlon
Reviews.Content: Besides the fact that it randomly restarts from time to time, it's wonderful. The battery can be drained quite quickly if you're not careful. The rear facing camera is very nice and has a flash for all lighting pictures. It is lightning quick compared to other tablets I've had and the display is remarkable in all aspects.  There is no micro hdmi port on this tablet to write it up to your tv and the option to do that I actually loved on the previous hd version.  The Mayday button is surprisingly useful. I never thought I would use the feature, but 30 minutes out of the box I found myself hitting the button:)Pros:ScreenSpeedMayday buttonRear facing camera w/flashCons:Battery lifeRestarting troubles(could just be mine)Lack of micro hdmi portOverall a very nice buy

Reviews.Title: Glad I upgraded.
Reviews.Author: Mbail
Reviews.Content: This is my third kindle fire and I am impressed.  It's lightweight without feeling cheap.  I don't mind holding my tablet for hours while reading.  The fire hdx is very responsive and does not bog down with the more graphic intensive apps. I like the upgrades that have been implemented with the new OS.  The e-mail app is very much improved and I like that I can download some prime videos to view offline.  I have not explored everything available, but I am happy so far.  Well worth the price for upgrading my previous kindle fire 8.9 hd.  I have even used the mayday feature and they solved my issue!  My magazines on my newstand were closing when I tried reading them and Sue solved my problem very quickly.  Turned out there was an issue with my device registration.  I will continue to recommend and purchase amazon products.

Reviews.Title: Very enjoyable
Reviews.Author: Mary Theresa Martinez
Reviews.Content: My son had the Kindle Fire HD 7".  I had planned to just borrow his device for mobile reading.  I often find myself waiting for him to finish with an activity or work.  I had been using my smartphone, Android os, to read and play a few games.  However, the tiny screen was leading to major eyestrain.  I can read a paper book, but during the winter it is dark when I am waiting on him to finish work and I was running down the car battery to read, if I didn't use the phone.  There also were some issues with the Android os and the Kindle app, Amazon kindly fixed those, but the screen was still very small.With the latest sale price on the Kindle, I decided to go ahead and purchase one.  I had intended to purchase the Kindle Fire HDX 7", but after some encouragement from my son, I purchased the 8.9".  I was afraid the larger device would be awkward to tote around.  I was very wrong.  I am actually reading more since I purchased the HDX,  The device was fairly easy to set up.  I turned it on and signed in -- and it defaulted to mountain time zone.  I don't live there anymore and it was annoying to hunt to find where to change the time zone.  I ended up borrowing one of the Kindle guides and learned many interesting things about the device.The device is for me, most of the time, but I was pleased to find apps for studying for the GRE for my son who is a junior in college.  I also like the language apps which help us master correct pronunciation.Since I have a small iPod, I don't use the Kindle much for music, at least not yet.  It isn't portable enough to fit in my pocket when I exercise, therefore I cannot comment on the speakers.  We will likely use the device for watching Amazon prime movies, assuming the streaming doesn't eat up our internet allowance which is why we chose the larger size.  I also find the clarity of the screen and speed to be excellent.A few things I would like to see changed -- I read more than one book at once.  With this Kindle I can set more than one bookmark in a book, but I can't "name" the bookmarks -- one for where I'm reading, one for something of note....  I would also like to be able to have a tiny box or something to display the current time and battery icon when I am reading, or playing a game.  I know others won't want that, so I would like to see it be an option.I purchased the WiFi model because I could not afford 4G.  I am pleased that the device automatically connects to the WiFi devices it has "met" before, automatically.  One thing I learned early on, make certain to fully shut the device off to conserve battery power.  If used mostly for reading, the battery really will last 16 hours, or more, but only if fully shut down, in sleep mode it will continue to consume battery power.We don't watch much tv, although we love old movies.  We don't do social networks, I tend to be a more private person, so I wasn't certain if I could find enough uses to justify the Kindle purchase.  I was excited to find one of my favorite apps, Laudate available, and I can get an assortment of other theological resources easily.There are enough differences between the HD and the HDX that I am very happy I waited and purchased the faster and clearer device.  I do recommend a cover and if possible a padded bag for anyone who is as prone to dropping things as I am.  Actually, I have put my ID, credit card, and cell phone in the outside pocket of the padded bag and left everything else behind.  I purchased the set of 12 accessories at the same time I purchased the device.  The cover isn't fancy and if I use it often, I'll have to replace it within a year, but it is fine for now.I did not think I would like reading without the physical feel of a book in my hands.  Admittedly, I cannot close the book when I finish an electronic book with the same finality.  However, we already have 20 bookcases, very full, and I am reluctant to purchase more paper books without getting rid of some.  It will be so much easier to throw the Kindle in the vehicle and know I don't have to box up all the books included in it when my son head off to post-graduate work and studies!  I also love that I can change the font of the electronic books on days when my eyes are tired instead of digging out a stronger pair of reading glasses!I will next see how I like having the Kindle read to me, but that is another adventure.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful screen, good sound, a few  minor dislikes...
Reviews.Author: CMB
Reviews.Content: I'm a woman in my late 50's, computer savvy but not a techie, and I like electronic gadgets.  I thought long and hard about buying a tablet (do I really need one???), and then about which one to buy.  Based on reviews on both Amazon and other websites, I had a hard time deciding between the Google Nexus 7 (the 2013 model) and the Kindle Fire HDX.  After playing with both of them for about an hour in Staples, I decided on the Fire.  I was originally going to buy the smaller Fire but got the 8.9" because I wanted to use it to watch videos.I really like it very much.  I'm not into apps, so it doesn't matter to me that I don't have access to the Google (or Apple) app store.  I use the Fire mainly for surfing, checking emails, watching video and listening to music. The interface is easy to learn and use, and things move with lightning speed.  The Fire does have an absolutely beautiful screen which makes watching videos a pleasure (the picture is much better than my TV).  I haven't actually purchased any videos but have found lots of things I like in the streaming videos.  Of course, this thing is an Amazombie's delight - it's easy (maybe too easy) to access videos, books, my Kindle library, etc.  I think the speakers sound pretty good on their own, but I got a little Jam speaker and also some bluetooth headphones and love listening to music via Pandora or my iTunes library.Some minor complaints:  I understand that the Silk browser is improved on the HDX, but I absolutely don't understand why it doesn't support Flash.  It would be much more useful if it did.  I installed the Dolphin browser, and can play flash videos, but Dolphin acts a little twitchy on the Fire.  Also, there's no way to organize bookmarks in Silk (there is in Dolphin).I wish that I didn't need a smart TV in order to mirror the screen and watch videos on my TV, but it could be time for a new TV anyway.  However, I've read other reviews and people are generally disappointed about not being able to use a cable to connect their Kindle to a TV while traveling.  It's too bad this feature was removed, but I knew that when I bought it.It's really easy to set up email accounts, but there's no way to organize email other than the standard folders.  Also, there appears to be no way to select all messages so I can delete them - I have to go through and select them one by one.  I wouldn't want to have this as my only was to receive and send email.I've had a couple of Kindle e-readers, and I like reading on the dedicated e-reader better than reading on the Fire.  It's nice to have color and the back lit screen is good sometimes, but there's a lot of glare.  The 8.9" size is a bit heavy for reading.  I've had to get used to reading on it, and I still use my Kindle Touch a lot.In general I'm really pleased with the Kindle Fire, and I use it a lot rather than getting out my laptop.  Although as I said, I like gadgets, but I don't have a smart phone and the Fire is in between a smart phone and a laptop - very useful except for making phone calls!  I chose the Wi-Fi only version because I don't want to pay for a data plan, and it was great on a recent trip where there was Wi-Fi everywhere.  I didn't have to bring along the laptop but was able to have all my books, music, plus check out hotels etc. all in one small package.  I'm glad I bought the Fire but hope for some improvements in the software.

Reviews.Title: CROOKED
Reviews.Author: spongebob "book lover"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for Christmas  for almost $500 and had trouble with it freezing up. Had to return it. They sent another but it was used.So I end up with a used kindle for the new price. They don't credit anything to you for sending you a used kindle when you pay for a new one. I called but they did absolutely nothing. So I think it's very crooked to pay for a new kindle and get a used one. So  just letting people know to be careful because if you have to exchange it you will get a used kindle. Will not buy another electronic from amazon. Very disappointed with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: My Newest Baby!!!
Reviews.Author: Reading Fanatic (CMP)
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 tablet.  This is the 6th Kindle we've owned in our family.  Our first foray into the Kindle world was the original Kindle Fire.  After that we purchased 2 of the second generation Kindle Fires and then I purchased a Kindle Fire HD 7inch.  We also have a basic Kindle e-reader.  Now, I've finally gotten the crème de la crème.....the 8.9 HDX.  I'm not a techno whiz by any means, so I can't tell you about all the bells and whistles this little baby has.  What I can tell you is that it is super user friendly and almost absurdly easy to use.  This tablet is now my primary means of surfing the web, watching videos, checking email, as well as reading.  It's like an all in one entertainment center.  I love the bigger 8.9 screen.  The additional ability to categorize my books into collections is awesome!  I have so many books, I often overlook ones that I've yet to read.  Furthermore, when I'm in the mood for a particular type of book I would have to search through my entire library to figure just what to read, and then oftentimes I'd forget whether a specific book was of the genre I was looking for.  Now that I've organized my books by genre, I no longer have that problem.  I love it!  My only complaint is that, while I am still able to review a book directly after reading it on my tablet, Amazon has removed the ability to edit the review once it's been submitted.  So many times after I submit a review I realize, after rereading it, that I've made some grammatical error.  Now because I am no longer able to edit the review once it's submitted, I have to go online via "Silk" and find my review in order to do the editing.  It is a bit of a pain in the....., but not overly so.  Otherwise, this tablet is just about perfect.  My husband has an Ipad and I would not give up this tablet for that one EVER!  He accuses me of loving the HDX more that I love him and our two children, to which I reply "of course!"  LOL

Reviews.Title: Love it, even though I already had to return one for a replacement. (also some notes on Mayday)
Reviews.Author: S. Siepel
Reviews.Content: I've waited a long time to purchase this tablet, waiting for one with both front and rear facing cameras and trying to save up enough Amazon points so that I could afford it. Finally, this December my hubby and I ordered one as my Christmas gift. Christmas day I pulled it out of the box and everything worked perfectly. However, early January I went to turn on my new Kindle in the morning and nothing. Dead. I followed the suggestions given on the Amazon website, but to no avail. Called customer service, and they end up sending me a new Kindle. I was truly bummed that my new device was faulty, but Amazon's customer service was excellent!So, after playing with my second Kindle and reading other reviews, here are my thoughts on this device.1. I love most everything about this Kindle, the light weight, the features, etc. Things that drive me a little crazy include the fact that the power and volume buttons are on the back.  It is awkward to feel around for the volume button while you are watching a video or whatever.2. Mayday is helpful but a little creepy. So, I was trying to figure out how to open Word documents that were sent as attachments via email. I had purchased the OfficeSuite Professional App and had no problems opening documents sent via Yahoo mail, but couldn't figure out how to use it for Gmail. I pushed the Mayday button and right away had a customer service rep online. He walked me through the issue. At first I thought "This tech is so cool. He can see/control everything on my Kindle," followed by, "Oh, that is kind of creepy." Not that this is any different then was Dell or any other computer customer service can do with your permission on your computer, it just struck me a little weird. BTW, contrary to other reviews, you can open email attachments on this Kindle from both Yahoo and Google mail servers.3. I love the video quality when watching something on this device, but not sure why they did not include an HDMI outlet so that you could watch on other devices, like your TV.4. Having Amazon Prime is definitely worth it, you just need to be aware of its limits. We have had Amazon Prime for years and use at least one of its features almost daily, whether it is free shipping, the free movies/TV, or checking out a free book from the Kindle collection. Amazon's new feature lets you download some (that should be capital SOME) Primes movies and TV programs.5. I have yet to find a cover/case that I really love for this device. I have the Amazon Origami case and the MarBlue Ultra Lightweight Origin Case for Kindle Fire. Neither have all the features I am looking for, like really good protection. If you have any suggestions I would like to hear them.6. I will probably continue to read books mostly on my Kindle keyboard e-reader. I work on a computer during the day. When I go to read at night I find the back-lit screens really bother my eyes. I have read on this Kindle just fine, but I prefer the size and screen of my Kindle e-reader for long stretches of reading.7. I would recommend setting up some parent controls, even if you are the only one using your Kindle. Once you turn on the controls you can go into the settings and choose the controls you want to use. For example, I want my Kindle to ask for a password before a purchase is made or a video is watched, just in case I accidentally hit a button or my kids happen to be using it.8 If for any reason you have to return your Kindle, I was  told by a customer service rep to deactivate the Kindle from your account for security reasons, even though the first thing Amazon does it delete all information on returned Kindles.9. I wish there was a charging indicator light. You plug the thing in and there is no way of knowing if it is charging or is fully charged.

Reviews.Title: The laptop of the future is here.
Reviews.Author: John Barry
Reviews.Content: HistoryWe've owned two original Kindle Fire's, a Kindle HD 8.9, Kindle HD 7" and now the Kindle HDX 8.9 64gig version.It is amazing. High resolution, fast and compatible with most of the apps on our cloud. We love it. We love having our books, movies (prime), music, games and apps all on the cloud. All accessible to our devices and smart phones.EmotionWe love it. By "we" I mean me, my wife and our 5 year old daughter, who has been using it since she was 3. She would have been using it earlier but we didn't have one.ConstructionIt is very thin, very fast and elegant. More-so than the HD version. The original Fire, which is highly functional, seems very primitive by comparison. Now one of our original Fire's broke. Amazon was kind enough to give us $75 credit on it. For this we are very grateful.FunctionalityMy wife is a Database developer and has resources that help her with her job.I am a musician. I have wonderful books, a 4 track mixer, can write notes, take video notes... browse the web, run apps, games, movies. it is beyond my wildest dreams and I am very impressed. At this stage in my life it takes a lot to impress me, but this has a lot.My daughter has tons of games (minecraft, reading apps, etc) that she adores. The worst thing is we have strive to limit her. Now the kindle will do that for us, but we still reserve the right to do that. She's very careful with her "Piggy" as she calls it. This is based on an early application (2 years back) that featured a "Piggy". Well, she loves it. We all call our kindles "Piggies" because of this.LongevityI don't know how it will hold up. I pray it will last years. I can see using it for years if it does. I can't imagine what Amazon's engineers will come up with in the coming years. It's yet another reason to fight to stay alive. I am amazed by technology. I rank this right up there with innovations such as the Kemper and almost the cell phone. It's just amazing and a game changer. IMHO, easily the leader in it's field.Tech SupportAmazon's tech support is top notch and second to none. They make a mistake they'll break their backs to fix it. If carriers make a mistake they do their best to make it right and then some. They don't have to, but this reinforces good-will and makes us come back to them time and time again. We love amazon. This product is tied to amazon and their success and quality shines through in this product. They deserve all of their success.Originality and other tabletsThere are many tablets on the market. The key competitor is the iPad and the two are very comparable. The iPad's keys to success are it's larger screen and it's elegant programs. It's weakness is it's cloud is too proprietary compared to the Kindle. I have two iTouches and like the elegant, well designed programs, but dislike iTunes. The Kindle beats the iPad in every other department. The Kindle HDX is less expensive, the programs are usually on par or close to Apple, and the resolution is actually higher on the HDX. The HDX also boast a faster quad core processor. This might be negated by the higher resolution of the Kindle but the difference is negligible.VerdictBoth. I would be happy with an iPad and a Kindle. If I had to choose one it would be the Kindle. Amazon has found a way to worm themselves into our lives and our hearts. Their relatively low priced kindle, great shipping, excellent selection of everything has done it. They are part of our culture with south park making episodes based on UPS/Amazon deliveries and so forth. It's a huge deal and probably the beginning of something larger than we can imagine. The only thing is, as Amazon grows, will it maintain it's integrity to itself and it's customers -- not sell out to corporate and powerful investors.

Reviews.Title: Video help
Reviews.Author: Johnny Kenehan "Johnny Kenehan"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle for my wife for Christmas; ordered it the 23rd and had it the 24th!  The unit is just unbelievably thin and sleek and it was fully charged out of the box.  It is an amazing unit, fast response, fantastic screen and then there is the live help.We had some problem getting the smtp settings right, just wouldn't work.  This is certainly not Amazon's issue, but an issue with finding the right settings for my internet provider.  In desperation, I thought I'd try the live help but I didn't hold out much hope, it was just before midnight on CHRISTMAS DAY!  After LESS THAN FIVE SECONDS after pushing the button, Deborah popped up in a little window and asked me how she could help.  I immediately looked to see if I had pants on ... but she said only I could see her!She was GREAT.  Took us about 10 minutes and I was up.  It was so cool seeing her draw on my screen and point to the needed settings.  I just could not believe the customer attention I got.  Damn, if I could give 10 stars I would!!!!  Amazon, you've really done it this time.  Even had the Kindle been less than stellar, I wouldn't have minded knowing my wife or I will always have the help we need.  BTW, YouTube videos played immediately and just as expected.  Well done Amazon, and "Deborah"!!!

Reviews.Title: A great improvement over the Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Judy L.
Reviews.Content: I am not going to repeat what has be expressed on other reviews, but will only tell you my opinion of the improvements over the Fire HD and compare to other tablets I have. If you want the tech specs, you can read them on the page for the tablet. So I won't repeat them here. I have and have had a number of tablets including the iPad AIR, iPad 3rd gen, iPad 7", Nexus 7, Nexus 7 2nd gen, Galaxy Note, Galaxy Note 3, Galaxy Note 8, and an Asus 10" (I don't remember the model). So I am very familiar with the different models and operating systems.I had a Kindle Fire Hd 7" that I sold because I didn't like the carousel, and getting to apps that I wanted to used wasn't convenient. The color, resolution, and sound were fine for my purposes to watch Amazon movies and to uses some apps, but it was cumbersome as compared to other android tablets that I had. Apps couldn't be grouped or organized as they could be on other tablets, and every app used was added to the carousel making the carousel lengthy and virtually useless.I decided to give the Kindle Fire HDX a try in hopes that some of the disappointments I experienced with the Fire HD were resolved. I have had the Kindle Fire HDX only a couple of days, but so far, I am impressed with the improvements. It still has the carousel, that can be useless if you use a number of apps or new apps are added - all are added to the carousel. Those that you don't use often have to be remove, one-by-one, manually. It would be nice if adding apps to the carousel was an option so that only most used apps could be added. (Hint to Amazon).On the plus side, you can now view all of your installed apps and execute them by swiping up in the screen. You can also group your apps into collections, or folders, and name the folders. In addition, apps in the apps view can be arranged in a way that makes sense to you by dragging and dropping them into position. In this matter, the Kindle Fire HDX function much more like other android tablets and is a huge improvement over previous versions of the Kindle Fire. This versions offers much more user control for organization and usage of the tablet.A couple other improvements that are obvious to me are the resolution and the crisp true colors. The colors on the screen really do "pop". In comparison to other tablets that I have, the touch response is extremely good, and the accuracy of the on-screen keyboard has been flawless. In addition, moving from the carousel to the apps screen and going from one app to another has been very smooth. There is no lag at all.I did have an opportunity access Mayday, that is reached by clicking the "?" icon. I used this at 3am, and go almost an immediate response. The representative was very helpful and answered all of my questions. I did find out that many of the Google apps are not compatible with the Kindle Fire HDX because developers have not made them compatible. They hope that this will change with future updates to the OS. In my experience, developers of apps have most developed the iPad apps and then the Google apps. The Google apps never seem to be quite as good as the iPad apps. Now that Amazon has developed  a very capable tablet, maybe developers will start to create more apps that are compatible. This is yet to be seen. In the meantime, users of the Kindle tablets are pretty much limited to apps available on Amazon other than a few Google apps that may be compatible.At this point, I would recommend the Kindle Fire HDX tor android flexibility, the improved display, and for use with Amazon Prime deals. I will update this review as I get more experience with the features of this device.

Reviews.Title: Impressive Improvement over KF HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Steward H.
Reviews.Content: While being very satisfied with our Kindle Fire HD 8.9, we were pleased to upgrade to the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 when Amazon offered the four payment plan. We purchased both of our Kindle Fire 8.9's with 32 GM of memory, without the special offers feature.We want to emphasize that the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is a very fine tablet, and if you do not have the extra funds to purchase the HDX 8.9, you should purchase the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 while they are still available from Amazon for $229. The two are very close in the quality of still and video graphics. At this price, they are an incredible bargain.Nevertheless, we were very pleased (amazed might be a better term) by the new Kindle Fire HDX 8.9. In the following commentary, keep in mind we are comparing the HDX to the HD 8.9.The new HDX 8.9 is noticeably lighter to hold, yet retains the solid build quality of the original 8.9. As far as still graphics are concerned, the colors are more vivid, contrast is even higher, blacks appear even blacker. In short, the display is amazingly impressive!  Comparing the two tablets side by side, it is as if the original image is being viewed through a very slight polarizing filter on the original HD 8.9.As far as viewing Video content, we noticed very little difference between the two tablets, with the original KF HD 8.9 perhaps having a slight edge. Both are excellent, movie picture quality varies widely. If you are a Prime member, try The Robe, or Contact if you want to see just how good the video quality truly is. The soundtrack on Contact showcases the sound quality possible with these tablets.The rear/back facing camera is fun to use, color is quite accurate. The camera is effective in relatively low light situations with low "noise". If high picture quality is required, we would recommend using your digital camera.The sound quality seems to be slightly better on the new model, which might be due to the altered position of the dual speakers. If you are watching a movie, you will definitely want to use high quality lightweight headphones. With these, the sound quality is very impressive.The New Silk browser is greatly improved.  Internet browsing is significantly faster with snappy response.Battery life is significantly improved, we noticed at least a 20% increase in useable battery life.Overall, the new Kindle FIre HDX 8.9 has managed to improve an already excellent screen image,  provide slightly better sound, added a useful rear/back facing camera, while being significantly lighter in weight.There really isn't anything we would describe as being negative with this tablet. Some icons, apps, and text appear slightly smaller in size because of the increased screen resolution, and one of our apps did not run properly on the new Kindle fire. If a reset is required, one must now depress the power button for a full 20 seconds, release, and repress the button to allow the kindle to reset. We only experienced one lockup requiring a reset, which we are sure was software related.If Amazon is still offering the four payment plan, there is no better time to purchase or upgrade. If not, we still are impressed enough to spend the full $444 for the 32G KF HDX 8.9, without special offers. (If you opt for 16GB and special offers, the price is less). You will not regret purchasing this item!

Reviews.Title: Best Kindle so far!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have been a Kindle user since the 1st generation readers came out, I have followed successive generations through all the iterations except the KIndle HD as I had helped a friend with one and really didn't like the weight, I had a 10.9 Android tablet that didn't weight anymore than her little 7 inch.  However, I had seen some of the reviews referring to how light the HDX was and my husband was like, well my little tech junky would you like that for Christmas. I of course did some research on the forums and said yes.  Now, one caveat, if you get frustrated with not being able to get a specific app you really want, be sure to go to the forums, I have not yet found an app that I couldn't get one way or another so I'm very happy with this light little unit.  I streamed a video or two from Amazon Prime without downloading and no hiccups or pauses, I was amazed at the image quality.  So, if you do your homework to make sure you can get the apps you want, then I would highly recommend this speedy, light, amazing graphics tablet.

Reviews.Title: Smaller screen than the iPad but far better in other areas
Reviews.Author: Vamsi P.
Reviews.Content: I was not sure about the Kindle HDX and almost bought the iPad Air but glad I got the Kindle instead. The screen is slightly smaller compared to iPad but Kindle is far better option especially if you have kids and if you want to use the device for media. I love the integration with Amazon Prime, Parental Controls are awesome and like the app store as well. I can say for sure, i am not  missing anything so far that I had with the iPad and this is a  great tablet  for both adults and kids.

Reviews.Title: Superlative
Reviews.Author: W. G. Butler
Reviews.Content: I am tech geek and own a Nexus 7 (2013 model), an iPad Air, and now a Kindle Fire HDX 8.9.  The Kindle Fire HDX could possibly be my favorite of the three (although they are all excellent devices).1) LOVE the form factor.  It's unbelievably light and makes the iPad Air, which I was previously amazed by, feel chunky in comparison.2) Fast processor and zippy graphics.  No lag in the user interface.  Everything loads up instantaneously and even graphically demanding games like Riptide GP run as smooth as butter.3) Great Amazon interface that gives me access to my Amazon Prime videos and video library (which I do not get on my Nexus).  I own many movies and TV shows in my Amazon library and it is nice to have access to these, as well as the dozens of Kindle books I own.4) Kid friendly options like Kindle free time offer tons of content for parents to let their kids enjoy.5) Mayday option is pretty cool.  I tried it out twice when I had some general questions about Kindle Fire OS and the representatives were friendly and helpful.  I never had to wait more than 10 seconds for a representative to appear.Here is how I would compare the devices:vs iPad AirI can do anything on my iPad Air that I can do on my Kindle Fire HDX, plus I have access to all of my Apple content.  The app environment is MUCH richer for the iPad then it is for the Kindle Fire HDX as there are many more apps and especially many more tablet optimized apps.Having said that the Kindle Fire is significantly cheaper and is also lighter, and Amazon pretty much has everything you need in terms of Apps, books, and media content.  So I would say that the Kindle Fire HDX is a poor man's iPad Air that is almost as good and would satisfy the great majority of consumers.  I also prefer the slightly smaller form factor and lighter weight of the Fire HDX.vs Nexus 7The Nexus 7 has a better app environment through Google play.  However, the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 has access to the video content from Amazon Prime and a bigger screen, more storage, and more powerful graphics and CPU.  I honestly like the HDX 8.9 better and would choose this between the two if I could only have one.  The Nexus 7 is still a great tablet though, especially for the price.  This is just a personal preference for me.  But Nexus 7 is the way to go if you are an Android fanatic or prefer a richer app environment.

Reviews.Title: A tablet superior to the iPad Air ( have both)
Reviews.Author: Dominic Wu "Digitari"
Reviews.Content: It is thinner, lighter, and has a better screen than the 800 lbs gorilla in the tablet market, especially considering that if you are viewing this review chances are you are already part of the Amazon ecosystem.  The HDX integrates with Amazon seamlessly making everything you do just works even better.  Your Kindle books (many free ones), your Android apps through Amazon app shop, Prime Instant Video streaming (ironically available on iOS but not Android).  Granted, it would have been nice to have the Play store feature but that would make the HDX with Mojito just another super thin and light Android tablet with a beautiful screen.  No star subtracted since it is meant to provide a complete user experience and differentiate itself from the other offerings.  The size is perfect and the way it balances in your hand, the placement of buttons (only 3, Power, Vol+ and Vol-) are all subtle yet greatly appreciated design choices..  I cant say enough good things about this tablet.  If you are in the market, have Prime, this is a no brainer.  About the only thing that could make this a better tablet is an even lower price to really seed the market.  Don't worry for Amazon, though, they will definitely make it back in added purchasing activities based on the HDX's usage, not unlike the Prime membership doubling the average purchases of the its members.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful New Improvements
Reviews.Author: Annie "Annie"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the new front and rear cameras and all the new improvements.  I have a Kindle Fire HD, that I was very happy with, but with all the new improvements on the HDX, I just had to order it.  The processing speed is lightening fast, the picture and video quality is the best, and this almost replaces my laptop for functionality.  I purchased the MS Office app, and it allows me to view, edit, and print any of my office documents.  I also love that all my apps, books, music, etc can be downloaded onto any of my three Kindles.  When I looked at the Apple and Kindle comparison, I happily chose the Kindle.  I highly recommend the Kindle over any other brand.

Reviews.Title: Great!!
Reviews.Author: Alberto Barraza
Reviews.Content: Will be purchasing this soon - amazing Trial experience. In my opinion it is better than the IPAD.The camera is amazing!

Reviews.Title: A WINNER!
Reviews.Author: Don McKeefery "micker61"
Reviews.Content: I have been shopping for a new "device" to replace my Kindle DX.  I was looking for something with more versatility, and that fits my lifestyle.  This is it!The screen resolution is superb!  The size is just right!  And, the features are spot on!I spent a few hours setting it up and loading on some familiar apps, as well as some new ones.  I found the ease of locating and loading to be intuitive.  In fact, everything about the device seems intuitive...which is something that concerned me at first since it is more than just an e-reader!Did I mention the blazing speed?  It's as if the device is reading my mind and is already queuing the next app that I want to open and use.  You no sooner touch the screen and your app is open and ready for use!  This concerned me with some of the other devices I looked at.  Blazing fast!!I would, and will, recommend this device to everyone who is looking for a feature-rich device.

Reviews.Title: i'm glad i bought it.
Reviews.Author: garyhere "garyhere"
Reviews.Content: i'm a 65 year old computer literate, but a smart phone android Luddite. i am pleased with this tablet. i had a fire hd last year i sent back because i was not happy with the performance. this is totally different. it is fast! almost as fast as my hard wired desktop. the touch screen is accurate. i don't think i've had to double tap anything. it activates the wanted icon and not the icon next to the one you want. all apps seem to operate smoothly, though i mostly use it for reading. the reading screen is adequate and, other then some glare, it is easy on the eyes. the browser is really quick. i use it mostly for reading and checking the web for questions i have about anything that comes up. the battery lasts forever. i have never run it down past 50% even after 8 hours of mixed use. while reading it seems to use almost no power. the screen is the best i've ever seen on any tablet. AND IT"S LIGHT!!! it weighs less than half of what my 7 inch original fire weighs. easy to hold and read for hours. the miracast works seamlessly without any digital skip or sound delay on netflicks and youtube. why not five stars? the mail app does not let you "select all" and delete more than one email at a time. there are a few other minor software glitches that i presume will be fixed. when downloading from usb to documents file as instructed i get a message that i can't download to that location, but when i reopen the unit the download shows up? . bottom line i'm glad i bought it.

Reviews.Title: Loving this so far!
Reviews.Author: Shrubbin Cole
Reviews.Content: I've been playing around with this tablet for about 2 or three weeks now!I love it so far, it's so light and portable compared to my other devices!PRO: Really good video quality and image quality --surprisingly nice back AND front camera o-o - lighter than my coworkers iPad air, what? o.o-- Built in surround sound on such a thin device? Super impressive. I was about to download and play movies with no issues for a 7 hour trip without the device dying. O.o -  Good for entertainment value: there's instant downloads of any amazon instant streaming device! There's also local storage.-- very responsive, not laggy, easy to learn and pick up-instant unlimited tech support that can annotate your screen to show you how to use the device-comes with free perks from amazon wish coins so you get some free credit--easy to sync across platforms! (You can do it via USB or there's Kindle syncing programs)--Battery lasts surprisingly long! I left it out for a few days and didn't bring it with me to school or to workand the device would still be on! If only my phone could last more than 5 hours...--This is running MOJITO which is android based and I'm really surprised how easy everything is to set up. No syncing issues, no email issues, i only had one issue with the cloud but logging out and logging back in worked. (hah)Cons--Limited app market (a lot of normally free apps don't exist, or are third party...) the most common ones are there like Facebook, Evernote, and Skype is Built in!-- NO SD? :( No expanded storage, but there's tons of streaming services.-- No Timer on the camera? I guess I need a third party app, but I actually use this feature a lot. >.<--Silk? I couldn't find dolphin in the store if it runs android... but it looks like it's getting updates. It's usability is a bit limited but you can do bookmarks, tabs, and all that stuff. It gets stuff done!--this is insignificant but is it really remarkable that the product comes with the charger?-- No Chromecast support! I wasn't able to set it up with an AppleTV either. :\Amazon's working on this device but they're definitely going in the right direction. :) It's a great entertainment device that's worth the value!To be honest is this item is not towards my demographic (I use network services and need a productive tablet, having only open office with limited interal storage and dropbox kinda scares me.) but all of my relatives love it!I'm keeping it anyway for my  parents as they picked it up right away. :) Even if I'm not home, the mayday button can show them how to do the same things!

Reviews.Title: Its My Best Friend, sorta
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Have loved all my Kindles and love this too.  The clarity of the screen is AAA rated.  So sharp.  I haven't tried the SOS yet but nice to know its there.  Love the speed of the processor and its ease of picking up wifi signals.  My only complaints are that they left off the mini HDMI port and I had just bought a cable to use it for my previous Kindle HD.  I had to buy another device and cable to make use of the mirroring to a TV screen to watch my Prime shows.  Also the buttons on the back rather than the edge make it quite inconvenient when you have a case/cover for your device and the front flap is open and wrapped around the back.  Come on Amazon/Kindle.  Run this stuff past some test people!  Overall though, you couldn't pry it out of my hands.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle HDX 8.9.  I have the original Kindle Fire 7" to compare it to.The only problem I'm having with the HDX 8.9 is that it doesn't hold a charge for long.  The first one I ordered came and was fine for 3 weeks and then I started using the camera and had the pictures on the carousel.  Then the battery would drain even while just sitting and not being used overnight or in the daytime.  It will drop 50% just sitting there asleep.Amazon replaced the first one with another HDX 8.9 and it seems to do the same.Issues seemed to begin when I started using the camera and having pictures on it.Now I don't keep any pics on the carousel and it helps but doesn't solve the problem.Battery does not hold a charge no matter what I do.  I only use it for short periods of time through the day, do not play games and don't Skype or anything.  Probably at the most 1.5 a day total and the battery drops about 50%.Otherwise I love my Kindle HDX for ease and convenience.Only wish the battery would hold a charge longer.  I can't imagine it lasting the 10 hours that they are talking about when using it.  It drains just sitting doing nothing.

Reviews.Title: Superb!
Reviews.Author: MarkMT
Reviews.Content: I've now had my HDX 8.9 for a month and after a couple of little hiccups I'm totally loving it. The screen is gorgeous, the user interface is very easy to use, the speed of the device is very snappy, it charges pretty quickly with the wall charger provided and the apps I'm using are great.In the first few days I had a problem with the device spontaneously rebooting and I was NOT happy. But a few days later Amazon pushed out a software update and about a day later I had a weird issue that led me to doing a factory reset. I'm not sure whether the original problem was with the Fire software or perhaps a rogue app I had installed, but everything is working fine now and I couldn't be happier.---Update: this review has apparently been classified with the 16GB Fire HDX 8.9, but I actually have the 64GB version. As I said, I couldn't be happier. I am also glad that I got the 64GB version - I initially started downloading movies at the top resolution (1080p I think) and it actually didn't take me too long to run out of storage after less than half a dozen downloads. I'm now using the medium quality (720p), which is perfectly fine and typically 2-2.5GB each.

Reviews.Title: THIS IS MY NEW BEST FRIEND!
Reviews.Author: terry lanning
Reviews.Content: I have never been much of a tech person but  I don't leave home without my Kindle.  In this world of hurry up and wait it is so very nice to always have something to occupy your time.  I can read, play games, check my e-mail or watch a movie or tv show that I missed.  You can't beat the picture quality, well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding product
Reviews.Author: Chad Simons
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9", HDX Display, Wi-Fi, 16 GB - Includes Special OffersI've bought a new Kindle each year for 3 years.  I've not replaced any because of problems but wanted the newer features.  The very first one I purchased still works perfectly and is a great product.  The improvements each year have been substantial and very much worth the price.  The ease of setup and quality of the product will keep me and my children Kindle owners.  Last years 8.9 HD I thought would be hard to beat but the new HDX is just amazing.  Smaller, lighter, much more powerful and the display has to be seen to be believed.  I'm a computer geek with pretty discerning taste but the Kindle's do everything better then expected.

Reviews.Title: Amazon did it again! We love the Kindle HDX 8.9" in our house!
Reviews.Author: Venus2471
Reviews.Content: The only con I find in this is I wish the battery time was longer.  I would recommend ordering a case and stylus at the same time you do the Kindle HDX.  I work better with a stylus then I do my stubby fingers.  I am not tech savvy but so far so good. I love the May Day button. I was a little freaked out the first time I used it thinking the Amazon tech could see me sitting in my PJ's with my hair a mess the same way I could see him. I quickly found out that wasn't the case. LOL...relief!  I've had it a few day's and have no real complaints thus far. The only problem I have had is having to hunt it down because family members keep stealing it from me. I would highly recommend this as a gift for yourself or someone special to you that likes to read books & magazines, use the internet, watch movies, listen to music, etc.  I just begun to tap into all the neat functions this device has. To me, tablets & ecspecially Kindle's, are the best new technological devices that have come out in awhile. My first was a Kindle Keyboard that I got for really cheap thru gathering points on another web site and this is my second. I do get the extended warranty but did not use it with my first Kindle. I did get it again with this one only because I began to have problems with the Kindle Keyboard after my warranty expired. I can't complain because it was heavily used & abused...LOL...I love Amazon's Kindles and the price is right for what I need it for. I do recommend getting the 8.9" because the size is just right to me.  I hope you enjoy it as much as we do ours!

Reviews.Title: Amazon did it again! We love the Kindle HDX 8.9" in our house!
Reviews.Author: Venus2471
Reviews.Content: The only con I find in this is I wish the battery time was longer.  I would recommend ordering a case and stylus at the same time you do the Kindle HDX.  I work better with a stylus then I do my stubby fingers.  I am not tech savvy but so far so good. I love the May Day button. I do recommend getting the 8.9" because the size is just right to me.  I hope you enjoy it as much as we do ours!

Reviews.Title: Thumbs up for the Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Paul Hysen "book owl"
Reviews.Content: The display on this device is amazing. There is no pixelation, even under a magnifier. This makes it very easy on the eyes. It is light and no burden to carry wherever you go and the battery lasts quite a while between charges, for a device of this nature. As you do not need a light to read by, it is the best book to take to bed. The wifi works great and eBooks are downloaded quickly. The interface works well and there are no obvious bugs. The book reader side of the Kindle Fire is as-easy-as and once a wifi connection has been established, you are set to go. My only criticism is that setting up the device can be a little confusing and at times frustratingly challenging, even for a seasoned computer user like myself. But I guess that is due to its Linux based Android operating systems, the inner workings of which only a seasoned Linux user would find anything less than esoteric. So some work on that aspect please Amazon, calling the help line is great, but the success of a device as regards the ease of setting it up, should be measured in the lack of calls, not its volume. But as far as the Kindle Fire HDX as a book reader is concerned, it's the Rolls Royce of readers, there is no better.

Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Author: Syreeta Brown
Reviews.Content: It's east to use, fairly lightweight, and I can take it with me anywhere and pull it out whenever I need it. It also works better with some apps than my phone does. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Amazon has done it again
Reviews.Author: Tom Henderson "musician in my mind"
Reviews.Content: I have the kindle touch and the first kindle fire and had no issues with them so when the HDX was announced I decided that an upgrade was due.  I received my HDX two weeks earlier than first promised and it has been better than expected.

Reviews.Title: kindle 8.9
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Carter "cartec"
Reviews.Content: I have owned three devices over the past ten years and this by far the best.  I know there are other pads, smart phones and readers to choose from but think any of them compare to the speed,  convenience, and ease the new kindle fire 8.9.

Reviews.Title: Amazon Kindle Fire HDX 8.9", HDX Display, WI-FI, 64 GB - Includes Special Offers
Reviews.Author: Vicky Bolen OHara "Kindle Lover"
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9", HDX Display, Wi-Fi, 64 GB with special Offers.  The problems I've encountered are with wi-fi.  Sometimes, I like working on my tablet, and sometimes, I like working on my Chrome Book (which I also purchased at Amazon).I think I have found the solution to the problem.  When I'm working on my Kindle HDX Tablet, I have to completely unplug my Chrome Book.  It worked last night, and today my Chrome Book is working fine, when I plugged it back in.  This might be a solution for Amazon's Customer Service if anyone calls in with the same problem.  Meanwhile, I had to spend more dollars with my internet people for a Wi-Fi Extender.  The Wi-Fi extender is mine to keep, so I've elected to keep it. However, if anyone has a problem with different devices vying for their Wi-Fi, this is the solution--completely unplug one device before using another device.As I said before, I Love, Love, Love, my new Kindle Fire Tablet. :-)

Reviews.Title: BEST KINDLE EVER!!!
Reviews.Author: Forest Fun
Reviews.Content: More powerful, faster, out of this world pix, front & rear camera, great sound on & on, but best of all is having Amazon at your side. May day!!!!  My few problems have been operator stupidity & were handled cheerfuly.  I  Iove Amazon !!!

Reviews.Title: Great - lighter than any of the earlier Kindle Fire's and only one ounce heavier than the smaller I-Pad Mini
Reviews.Author: SAM
Reviews.Content: Lightweight, on/off and volume buttons flat on the back, better definition on most game screens - I have the original Kindle Fire, and the second version with the larger screen and still use them both, but the 8.9" with the HDX display really does have improvements over the last version.  I also have an I-Pad Mini which is not as easy to use and I have had to call their Help desk multiple times because of problems accessing features and starting apps.  I have never had to call Help for any of the Kindle Fires I have because I could always find an answer in the pre-loaded Guide.

Reviews.Title: Amazing tech, but deserves some hesitancy
Reviews.Author: Brian Real

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo1VSXOSX3IV21AcurrentClick) { return cv_mo1VSXOSX3IV21AcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 2:21 MinsThe tech behind the HDX 8.9 is amazing and completely lives up to any and all hype. However, I have had some hiccups with service quality worth noting.The big issue is that the device would not download anything a couple of days ago, with everything just hanging in the queue. I hit the Mayday button, and someone eventually called me back. This was the second time I used Mayday, and the second time I was shifted over to someone else on a different platform. So, to be clear: Mayday is not a tech support service, but what you use when you can't figure out how to crop an image or something else simple. Considering the considerable amount of promotion around instant customer service via Mayday, this is a massive limitation and is the reason for one of the missing stars in this review.I received a phone call from an Amazon rep immediately after getting off the line with the Mayday rep, and this phone interaction lasted more than an hour. He made an earnest effort to help, but it actually made the problem worse. See the attached video - which I made for an earlier and considerably different draft of this review - to see what happened. I actually lost access to my book library. I eventually fixed this myself, by resetting to factory default. But, this then required more than an hour of re-customizing my device.On top of this, five graphic novels I purchased for the Kindle are only downloading in low-resolution files, making them look outright blurry. This appears to be a software issue, since a service rep was able to download higher res files to his device. It is automatically pushing these five - and just these five - titles to my device in inferior quality. I did both a Mayday call and an e-mail about this about two weeks ago, with no resolution, and no follow-up until yesterday.A very friendly customer service rep called me last night and took notes on both the major problem that led to the reset, and the graphic novel issue. He is still researching the latter.I hope that these are temporary issues that are just coming with a new launch and that I will be able to add another star to this review soon. However, until I can get content I paid for at a reasonable quality and go a few more weeks without having to reset my device (note: I never had to reset my original model Kindle Fire in two years of ownership), I am hesitant to enthusiastically recommend this, despite the awesome hardware.Note: This review is almost completely rewritten from the original post, reflecting some responses from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Light, Thin, an iPad contender
Reviews.Author: Chow
Reviews.Content: What an improvement over the Kindle Fire HD! First impression was, Oh my God! its so light! lol A real contender in competing with the Apple iPad Air. Light, thin, and very responsive. Some folks have complained about a light blue haze around the border of the display frame, but I dont see it on mine. I bought the 32GB wi fi model and the price difference from a comparable Apple product is a difference of $150 savings. Audible.com is owned by Amazon now so your audible books are instantly available from the cloud. Sound is very good. Reading books, superb. Gmail, oh yeah. My favorite apps like Evernote, Pandora, PBS videos, Twitter, Facebook, mulitle News channels, and of course Amazon movies rental are all there.

Reviews.Title: Unbelieveable how much improved....
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am upgrading from my original 8.9" fire. WOW!! lightning fast, great viability in bright sunlight, Connection to the net great. Sound much improved, light as a feather. I could not be more satisfied. What an improvement! I recommend the Fire HDX to anyone looking for a super fast, well designed tablet. Especially if you are a  book reader, surf the net (which with the HDX is so much faster now it's hard to even compare to the original Fire 8.9"...... I bought the 32Gig, with WyFi. I didn't opt for 4G. I can only imagine how that could make it better. The Fire HDX 8.9" 32 GB gets 5 Stars... because there aren't 6 or more.Dr. Geoffrey Britt

Reviews.Title: Finally Amazon Matched or exceeded Ipad
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Finally, Amazon learned as how to make an excellent tablet. It has all the features you want - light enough to hold on one hand, best resolution in tablets, all the apps that most people use (I am assuming that 80% of the folks use 20% of the apps), outstanding exchange email app that sync contacts with facebook, front/rear facing camera and last but not the least - very fast. Top it off with all the content and the best cover I have seen for a tablet - There is the perfect combination. I bought the wifi version and after 15 minutes, I wish I had ordered a 4G LTE version. It is so good that I want to be able to use it all the time wherever I am. Also it doesnt have a Youtube app, but the safari browser can play youtube in HiDef. So for me, it works!Folks, you wont be disappointed by getting one of this.

Reviews.Title: Very Cool
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Alright, I've been using a Galaxy Tab 8.9.  It's been a good tablet, a workhorse for me, but it's past it's prime.  I initially balked at the Fire when it was first introduced.  Not enough apps, the presentation was so different, etc.  But a few months ago, I ran thru all the apps I use every day and they were all offered by Amazon's App Store.  Combine that with the fact that I'm an Amazon super-user, I decided to take the plunge and get the Kindle HDX 8.9.Well, I've been using it non-stop for about 6 hours and it's awesome.  Display is fantastic, very light, Everything loads fast, video streams well, and my books look great. (No blue tint on border that I can see.  I've read in different settings and lighting, and no color tinge of any kind.)As an Amazon Prime and Audible member, I was also looking forward to their integration into the Fire.  It is great!  Amazon Video is fully integrated and I can even download some shows, apparently.  Haven't tried it, but looking forward to it.  Great option for traveling, I think.  And with Audible integrated into the Fire, you can do immersion reading if you own both the Kindle and Audio versions of a book.  That sounded cool to me when I heard it . . . and it is!  I recommend it to all readers out there.  A lot of great deals to be had as well i.e. Many Kindle books have a deal that once you purchase the ebook, you can purchase the Audible version for $.99-3.99 Great deals.The only thing I'm working thru is getting used to the interface.  It's pretty, and it makes sense, but it's new to me so there's a bit of learning curve.  But I'm getting there.Lots of other bells and whistles, but that's my initial impressions.  I wholly recommend it to anyone looking for a high performance tablet at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful, but does lack a little.
Reviews.Author: Jackie Gill
Reviews.Content: First, I am giving this 5 stars because it really is beautiful, has an outstanding display, and is very light. However, it does have some limitations.What I like:The display! I have had an original iPad, a 4th generation iPad with Retina, and an iPad mini - this display blows them out of the water.The speed: This pad works flawlessly. There are no hangups, no freezes, and no stuttering during video playback.iCal CAN sync with this: Many will say that your iCal cannot sync with your Droid based devices. YES IT CAN. All of my computers are Macs and I love iCal. Furthermore, my Macs store all of my contacts and task lists. There are apps that will sync your contacts, calendar, and your tasks. I use CalDav-Sync available via Kindle store and Google play and everything I update on my Mac shows up on my Note 3 and Kindle HDX. I do not care for the included Kindle calendar (I am a big calendar person) so I also bought AwesomeCalendar and it is a great calendar app. CalDav also works to update this calendar with all of my information on my Mac and I never have to do a thing to make it happen.Reading Features: I considered the following before purchasing this Kindle: iPad mini with retina, Samsung Note 8.2", and a Kindle HDX 7. I am pretty tired of Apple products. I am not saying they aren't great, and it is the only computer I will buy, but I like new things. Each time I purchased a new i-product it seemed so much like the previous that it just didn't feel new. Therefore, even though the new Mini with retina is beautiful, I ruled it out. I really like the size, shape, and feel of the new Samsung Note 8.2." Samsung went back to black and moved away from that strange brown decision and I love the ability to use the stylus. Plus, I also switched from an iPhone to a Note 3, so this means all of the Apps I have purchased in Google Play would be available for my pay as well. So, this being said, the Samsung Note 8.2" was almost my new pad. However, it is very similar to my Note 3 and the the Kindle beats everyone in one area: READING. Yes, you can get the Kindle app on your other products, but you can't get immersion reading. I have not built my library via iBooks, luckily I have purchased all of my books via Kindle. So, when I opened my box and pulled out my new Kindle, they were all there. I am a PhD student in the dissertation phase, so I read A LOT. not all of my books have been available via Kindle, but when they are they are less expensive and I love the note taking features. I do think the note taking features and highlighting works better on the Kindle than it does through the Kindle app. You are allowed multiple highlighting colors to choose from, it keeps track of my notes and reading on all of my devices, and you can get the audio versions of the books (if available) for very good prices. I have been an Audible fan for a long time. I know many do not care for audio versions, they prefer to read. Immersion reading combines them! This is WONDERFUL for me because I like to accomplish tasks while listening to a book, but if I need to highlight something, the immersion reading will show me where I am and I don't have to hunt. This is a big upgrade and what tipped my decision to make this purchase. Now, at the time I was not thinking about actually carrying this thing around while I listened, and the 8.9 is a little large for that, perhaps the 7 would have been the better choice, but the 8.9 isn't too heavy and I can always listen on my sisters 7", or i-product if I am moving around and it will sync with my 8.9" to let me know exactly where I left off.The organization of the Home screen: I really like the carousel and the folders that you place apps in. Unlike Apple app folders, the Kindle allows you to place many apps in a folder (this may have changed in recent Apple IOS updates, not sure).Weight: Very light! I like the feel of this pad. It is lighter than the iPad air and does not feel cheap to me (the 7 inch does not feel substantial enough to me).Aesthetics: I love the all over black! I find this to be a beautiful pad. Comparing it to the iPads, I cannot say that one is better looking than the other because I think they are both beautiful in their different ways; however, this has a rubberized back that makes it MUCH easier to hold onto. I also prefer the shape. iPad is a little wider and I don't think it is necessary. I prefer the more 16:9 shape. I had a very difficult time deciding on whether to buy this because of size. I found that an 8" display was perfect. The full size iPad was too large and too heavy. The iPad mini was just right, although I still prefer the more rectangular look of the Kindle 8.9" and Samsung 8". I felt the 7" Kindle was just too small. The 7" feel a little cheap to me and there just isn't enough screen for reading. Moving back up from the 8" mini made me nervous. I will say that I do wish this Kindle was slightly smaller. Even moving down to an 8.3 - 8.5 would probably help, but it is not overwhelming. I am still happy that I chose the 8.9" over the 7" and I really do like the size and shape when viewing movies.Ability to download free content: One of the big pluses of a Kindle is Prime. I know you can download content from iTunes and get movies and such that way, but I have NO DESIRE to pay $20 for a download I will watch once. We take a road trip every summer and WiFi/4G is not always available. Plus, streaming via 4G eats up a lot of data. So, I wanted to be able to download movies and TV to watch on the road. You can do this with Prime and they do have free content (I'll also discuss this more under what I don't like). Amazon also gives away a free paid App a day. This is pretty cool. I log in every day and download most of them. Most are games, I would like more variety, but they are free :-).Origami Case: if you buy the Kindle HDX 8.9 or 7, I highly recommend the origami case. For my previous i-products I have purchased multiple cases and contraptions to hold them where and how I wanted them. Never has any case been as nice and met all of my needs like this one. I did and do not like the price of this case. It is about even with Apple brand leather iPad cases, but those are incredibly overpriced as well (and I do not like Apple smart covers, they are far inferior to this case). However, this case, at least, does a GREAT job. I did choose the leather and I am glad I did. It feels like a very nice quality leather, has not scuffed, smells good, and the Kindle fits it perfectly. The case also allows you to easily push the Kindle up to take photos, control power, and control volume. My sister bought one of the non-leather origami cases for her Kindle HDX 7, and while the case functions just the same and is a great color, I really prefer the leather - it just feels better, looks nice, and has a leather rather than chemical smell. The magnets in this case are great, holds very securely, and they turn the unit on and off. The case folds back flat, or holds the unit vertically or horizontally; and, if you like to read it bed, it does a great job of holding the Kindle up on your stomach or on a pillow. Again, while I agree this case is expensive, I do believe it is the only case I will need to buy for my Kindle.What I don't Like:Number one biggest complaint - DESKTOP BACKGROUND and Home screen images. You cannot change them! This is crazy to me. I did not expect this and I am disappointed. This in no way has anything to do with the function of the device, but I really like personalizing. I chose no advertising - there is enough of that in the world - and I removed the Amazon recommends section on the home-screen; but, that is where my choices ended. I cannot change the black background and I cannot choose what images greet me when I open my cover. I don't know if Amazon chose to do this because of their advertisers and/or for ease of help via MayDay (which I have never used, it isn't a complicated tablet), but I DO NOT LIKE IT. I want to open my pad and be greeted by my Boston Terrier, not a generic picture (although the lock screen images are pretty nice looking). I think this could be easily fixed via software update, but I also assume Amazon left this common feature out on purpose and doesn't plan to include it.Amazon Prime Free Content: I stream via Prime and Netflix and between the two I get most of what I want. However, I wanted to be able to download shows and movies and take them on the road with me. First, know that this EATS YOUR MEMORY. I chose the 64GB pad and it doesn't take much to fill it if you choose HD - a couple of movies and a few episodes of a show and you are full. You can choose lower quality, but it does look inferior on this exceptional screen. Downloading HD is also incredibly slow. I have pretty fast connection, but HD takes forever! That being said, the worst part is that there really isn't much to download. Sure, Prime offers a lot, however the majority of Prime cannot be downloaded. Hopefully this will change, but this is a feature that I was hoping to get a lot more out of.Size: The jump from a 7" to an 8.9" is pretty big. I wish they would offer an 8.2 - 8.5." It would be a little more slender, easier to fit in a large pocket and easier to hold with one hand. One thing I like about the 7" is that I can hold and control it with one hand. The 8.9" requires two hands. Still the size it much better than the full size iPad.App Store: I don't feel the app store is all that lacking. It is pretty extensive and serves most of my purposes. Unfortunately I have had to purchase duplicate apps because my iTunes purchases obviously don't transfer and Kindle does not use the Google Play store. The perfect device would allow purchases from all of them, but I get that this won't work. There are apps in all three app stores that are not available for one or the other. So, there are still apps on my i-products that I can't find for my Android devices and there are apps via Droid that I can't find for my i-products.Final thoughts: The perfect pad for me would be around 8.3 inches, include a Samsung-like stylus, have the power and performance of i-products, work with an app store that has all apps for all platforms, be very customizable, be very light, and include all of the reading features and Prime features of Kindle. It would also fit in an Origami case because it really is the best case I have used. That being said, at this point, Kindle simply offers more of what I am looking for in a tablet. I don't know if my perfect pad will ever exist, but, in the mean time, this one is pretty great!

Reviews.Title: HDX 8.9 is Fantastic and and the Installment Plan is Great!
Reviews.Author: TLS
Reviews.Content: I have owned a Kindle from the 2nd generation through PaperWhite.  I have looked at the Fire for quite a while but was not sure how the reading experience would be.  Then I saw I could pay for a Fire on a no-interest installment plan - so I went for it.  The marketing beauty of the installment plan is that it lets you upgrade to the larger size Fire over five payments rather than one big lump.  Memo to Jeff Bezos: smart, very smart in coming out with the installment plan.Now about the Fire experience.  It is great on all fronts - I've watched a movie, read The Week magazine, and read a book.  Looked at YouTube videos using the free app.  Downloaded other apps.  The screen is so sharp, the 8.9 size is great and it's not too heavy, the battery life is pretty close to stated, and the interface is very easy to understand.  Since I have the PaperWhite, a lot of the learning curve was already taken care of.  However, even if you have never used a Kindle product, the interface is very intuitive.Of course, the breadth and depth of the Amazon ecosystem means just about any book, digital magazine, movie, or whatever is available with one click (maybe that's why Amazon calls it "one click").  And Prime means you can see a lot of movies and TV shows at no cost (think Downtown Abbey, Hunger Games and 007 Skyfall).  Getting Prime if all you are looking for is video content may not be the best deal at $99 (I paid $79 in the last few days before the rate went up).  However, if you do a lot of Amazon purchases, the 2nd day shipping is awesome and on top of that you get video content!The Fire 8.9 out of box experience was great.  No defects, no blue margin haze, started up and has run like a champ from the very first moment.So here is the bottom line from my perspective.  If all you are doing is reading long form text in books, the PaperWhite is the best solution.  However, if you have ever had the desire to watch a movie, read a digital magazine, check out what's happening on YouTube, etc. - buy, buy, buy the Kindle Fire.  The reading experience is very, very good and a whole new world opens up through the diverse capabilities of the Fire.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Cathleen Countryman
Reviews.Content: The color is fantastic and even better it's so easy to use which is key for me. I don't have little ones to show me how to use technology and I find this one to be seamlessly easy to use. Plus help is available from Amazon. Super usable and super high quality. I'm so happy to have this.  My sister has the I-PAD and I like mine soooo much better!  Thanks Amazon for a great product.

Reviews.Title: So much better than my iPad
Reviews.Author: Michelle B. "Originally from Kansas"
Reviews.Content: I've had all 4 of the iPad generations prior to the iPad Air.  I was trying to decide between getting the new iPad Air or a Kindle Fire HDX 8.9".  My requirements were for something to take on long haul flights loaded with movies and books.  I chose the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" because of its size (lightweight), its resolution and access to my Amazon Prime assets. In my travels with my current iPad, I would have to clear the iPad and reset to load even two movies and 3 books.  Very frustrating.  I've had to go back to factory settings three times.  Granted I have less memory on this iPad, but.....I was a bit worried after I first got it because I had read I couldn't download any of the Amazon Prime free movies....not true....and, because I read that once I rent other movies on amazon, I could only download 2 movies...again, not true. I now have 5 movies and a ton of books downloaded....I'm ready for my next long haul.  I'll update this review after my trip.

Reviews.Title: Would have been 5 stars except for...
Reviews.Author: Robert K. Baldwin
Reviews.Content: If I had done this a month ago I would have rated it 5 stars.  It still is, in and of itself; but here is the thing.  I have all Kindles!  All of them.  The first, just a reader is the best thing I have ever bought, it is perfect in every way.  It is old now and I still use it and still does what it is supposed to do.  Then I got the Kindle Fire.  It was ok but had No Volume, I sent it back and Amazon send another one and it was fine.  Not impressive but still ok.  Then came the Kindle HD.  It was great but had one dead pixel, so it went back, the replace is fine.  When it came time for the HDX I was ready!  Couldn't wait, bought it the first day available.  For better than a month it was absolutely perfect!  No problem of any kind in any way.  Then all of a sudden it had full RAM.  Could get out of its own way.  To make it worse, when I called Mayday, they had no idea what I was talking about.  They just said well you have 64 GB and only 11 GB is used so it is ok.  I explained that we were talking about RAM and that it only had 2 GB so they said well in that case it is bad!  So again they replaced it.  This one so far is perfect.  But of the four I've bought three went back!  That is too bad.  I have suggested to a lot of folks that they buy this Kindle and I do believe it is the best choice out there, but I am embarrassed that of those my friends have bought some of them have already gone back.  It is called Quality Control.  Amazon Figure it out!

Reviews.Title: The Best at What It Does
Reviews.Author: TEQ "TEQ1"
Reviews.Content: Sound was the deciding factor when deciding to purchase either an Apple Air or an Android tablet such as the Kindle Fire HDX.  Apple puts not effort into the audio experience of their tablets and laptops, assuming, I guess, that everyone will want to use those damned earbuds all the time.  I got really tired of plugging in an external Logitec stereo device into my iPad 3 whenever I wanted to watch a movie, really tired.  Make no mistake, the HDX's speakers don't generate a concert-like experience, but it's far better than the iPad Air.  I also found the reduction in size and better display resolution to be helpful for reading.  Easier to hold, and fonts are rendered far more smoothly on the HDX display than Apple's retinal screen.  Steve Jobs would have to agree.  I don't understand why buyers would rather put up with continuous advertising than paying the few extra bucks for the ad-free version of the Fire HDX.  The HDX's version of Android also is kind of annoying.  Transferring movies from computer to tablet requires third-party software to remove DRM coding, whereas with Apple and even the plain Kindle Fire, movies are a simple drag and drop task.  Android's a pretty decent OS, but you wouldn't know it by the HDX.  You also have to be careful with Amazon Prime video.  Amazon subtly combines rental/purchase movies & TV with it's free Prime content, and it's pretty easy to press 'Watch Instantly' and later find out you've paid $5.00 to rent a movie.  You also probably notice a yellow cast to the display, especially with skin tones.  This is likely intentional to make the display appear better than it is, but I don't know why the Kindle makers thought this necessary since it's already the best display out there.
