Reviews.Title: Google Play!!!
Reviews.Author: QuietBillG "William E Gilbert"
Reviews.Content: I would give this a 5 star rating if it had the Google Play store!  This BULL S*** competition between Amazon and Google is only hurting Amazon's customers!!Amazon does not sell it's own phone, so most of us have Android phones (crapples are not real phones!) so we buy apps from the Google Play Store. If we want to use the same app on a Kindle Fire we have to buy it again and that is only if it is available in the Amazon App store (and MOST are NOT)!!And I am NOT going to root this. It should function correctly right out of the box.I will NOT be buying another Amazon product until they fix this issue!! The Fire TV is a waste of money until this is resolved!I will keep the Amazon Prime because I can use it on my Roku, Tivo, xBox 360, xBox One, PS3, PS4, Vizo TV, and my laptops (and it is a good deal).QUIT HURTING YOUR CUSTOMERS!!!!Edit: I want to clarify my opinion here - I love the hardware in this tablet, it is an outstanding tablet for the Amazon infrastructure. It is just not very useful for anything else.

Reviews.Title: Office Suites not really installed
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: First of all I love my new Kindle Fire HDX for overall content delivery. However I must point out what I believe to be false advertising in regards to Office Suite. What you get by default is just an Office document viewer. You do not get the Office Suite application which cost additional money.Even the Mayday rep thought the real Office Suites was supposed to be installed. I'm very disappointed in Amazon for implying that the real Office Suite was installed.

Reviews.Title: Not an ipad
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire is OK for playing games but not much else.  Don't like the carousel or the fact that you are asked to download/purchase other items constantly.  Should have bought an ipad.

Reviews.Title: If you got it for christmas, you might not know … it's blind in sunlight
Reviews.Author: YukonCat
Reviews.Content: I had a disabling injury in the Fall, and my husband got me an early Christmas present of a Kindle 8.9 HDX.  Mostly I used it for reading, and sometimes web surfing.  I never left the house so my WiFi was always available.  Yes, the ads were annoying,and yes, the screen design seemed very non-intuitive. It took me weeks to find basic settings.  But then I was sick.But now, it's summer in Texas and the pool is warming up.  My favorite summertime activity of the past few years has been pool floating with my kindle in hand.  Imagine my shock and dismay when I took my glitzy new color Kindle outside, only to find it is hopeless in sunlight.  The screen resolution is reduced to about 10% of indoor view-ability.  I felt betrayed.  I don't remember seeing anything about that little issue in any of the reviews or product descriptions.  Had I known, I would have gotten another basic kindle and saved myself $300 and a big disappointment.  Cathy - Houston.

Reviews.Title: Prefer it over the IPAD
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: I received my Kindle HDX 8.9 through Best Buy with my reward points and I must say I really enjoy it. I am a current Kindle HD owner, but my child confiscated it from me so I used this as an excuse to upgrade. First thing I notice is the HDX is thin and very light. The sound is incredible, the screen is very nice and the processing is smooth. I haven't had any issues with the device, but it is an electronic so I am sure it will freeze up or get hung up somewhere down the line. I have owned an IPAD before and after using the HDX I truly believe I over-payed on the IPAD. I am a true believer in the KIndle after owning one previously. It does everything I want it to for a much lower price (Even though I got it for free). I did have enough points for an IPAD but I still chose the HDX. The sound is so much better than the IPAD, the picture, in my opinion is better,  The only thing I don't like is that Amazon does not have a NOOK app. I wanted to retrieve my NOOK books, but I suppose it is good business not to promote a competitor. I would recommend the HDX or the regular HD to people.

Reviews.Title: does so  many things but does not print from browser
Reviews.Author: Corbaley
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed to read all the many things this does, but, according to Mayday, the BROWSER IS NOT COMPATIBLE TO PRINT. This means you can't print anything from anywhere on the internet. My Mayday rep informed me of a "work around" and I tried it but I was not able to print the full page I was trying to, the quality was poor, and it only works on a single page. This is a HUGE oversight to me, to not even have this be mentioned in all the advertising, and it might well be a deal breaker.Yes, it will print from email and original documents but this is not adequate for me in a tablet that is advertised to be able to stand alone.. Even my little, old iPod touch is able to print directly from the internet to my wireless printer with ease. I just spent a lot of money to get something that doesn't provide a major function I need. Have to think on whether it goes back as maybe the next model will provide this basic function. Shame on you, Amazon!!!

Reviews.Title: WIFI huh??????
Reviews.Author: Michael Regener
Reviews.Content: Amazon. How can you sell a product that's this poor. The WIFI on this device, was it even tested?? Product consistently drops its WIFI connection with no cause and seemingly no fix from Amazon support. At least issue a statement and tell us your working on a fix!Yes the product has great features. BUT WHAT GOOD ARE THEY IF YOU CANT CONNECT OR YOU KEEP GETTING DISCONNECTED FROM YOUR INTERNET. I DOUBT IPAD HAS THIS ISSUE. GET REAL GUYS AND TEST THIS STUFF BEFORE YOU START MASS PRODUCING AND SELLING THESE PRODUCTS!

Reviews.Title: notso hotso
Reviews.Author: DixPix "DixPix"
Reviews.Content: Recently purchased the Fire HDX and the Google tablet, our first two tablets. The Nexus is wonderful. Although it is a great size at 8.9 inches, I find the Fire tablet to be very frustrating.When using the keyboard it seems that it put spaces in all over the place and is very hard to type what we want. When editing it is almost impossible to put the cursor where you want it - sometimes the cursor is not visible and sometimes it isn't showing up even though the computer has you set to type from that spot . The capitalization seems to jump around without asking it to. It seems to put a space at the beginning of each paragraph, and takes several steps to get rid of it since you can't move the cursor accurately. Voice recognition is ever so much better on the Google Nexus.  And in general the screen touch sensitivity just seems to be off.  Lots of retyping.When you set a bookmark it is named sometimes in caps sometimes not, sometimes with icons and sometimes not.  Bookmarks are in one menu system at the top left. Saving a bookmark is in another menu on the right. The buttons on the edge of the screen are not there for some of the applications, so you have to get completely out of the application to get the home button back.We knew that the application store would not include many of the games and other applications that are available on all other tablets. Didn't think that would be such a big deal. But to discover that some very common applications and games are not available in any way on this tablet makes it much less useful.I could go on with many other little frustrations, and there are many more . This is probably a fine tablet for some people, but it sure isn't working out for me.

Reviews.Title: Watch out for wifi version
Reviews.Author: Fred Williams
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to using the Kindle Fire HDX. Bought the 32 meg version in wifi only. Therein lies the problem. When it works it works well. But it has difficulty hanging on to wifi signals and just quits at times. Apps don't update well with wifi. Display is great but it just doesn't work well with wifi, even though I am 20 feet from the router.

Reviews.Title: PRIME Member returned after 2 weeks & My "Mayday" experience
Reviews.Author: MountainMan "David"
Reviews.Content: The Good1 - Built-in Dictation. This feature works pretty damn good. See:dmediamomDotCom/2013/12/11/are-you-using-the-kindle-fire-hdx-dictation-feature/2 - Screen, duh! It *is* nice and everybody has talked about it.3 - Keyboard, especially "long-press" for numbers and special characters.4 - There is a scrollable word correction display as you type that would be annoying on an android phone but work well here.5 - Battery charges to 100% overnight and I have never gone below 50% with the exact same usage I gave my laptop every day. But I do not remain tethered to it like some people that I know. As for playing games, although I had about a dozen on the HDX I did not find one addictive enough to play for more than just a little while.The Bad (FYI, submitted to Amazon's returns-feedback email address.)1- Documents I copied over according to directions that the HDX provided after clicking on the "Docs" menu were not showing up in the docs section. I copied them over in individual year-dated subdirectories that the HDX does not recognize. It appears that, although folders (sub-directories) can be copied from laptops to Documents through Android File Manager (AFM) and are visible on the kindle through AFM, the Kindle software through the DOCS menu cannot see sub-directories (folders). I have several years of files on my laptop that reside in their respective years' folders. It appears the only option I have is to copy every year into the single Documents folder on the Kindle. This is unacceptable as it would make sorting (without renaming each and every file) impossible because most of the files have the same name. Sub-directories and sub-folders have been included since computers' existence. Leaving such a basic capability out (it is not even a "feature" but a common sense capability of all computing) makes the Kindle Fire HDX "Documents" menu item useless. This screams for a software update. Fortunately, I could see the document subdirectories in ES file explorer and in Kingsoft Office.2 - I also tried using the email documents option. The only problem with that is you cannot edit documents once they get to Kindle because double-clicking on the document pops it into Kindle like it was a non-editable book.3 - I could not watch live internet television due to I get the "need to update flash player." Sideloading Adobe Flash works but audio/visual is out of sync. I tried with both Firefox and Dolphin. Forums here and on XDA were no help. "Mayday" rep said "they are working on it and I will submit a ticket." Like that would help with a known issue.4 - Attempted to watch CBS's new series Intelligence." When prompted, I allowed Amazon's BETA streaming player to load but the video/audio sync is still off. Audio is before video. To confirm it was not my router, I put the Kindle HDX next to my laptop and started both of them at the same time. My laptop was perfectly sync'ed. [Note I was only offered to use this BETA software when watching CBS, not CNN or other networks streaming through the internet.]5 - The most disturbing thing to me is that after using Amazon's BETA streaming player for 30 minutes it started playing commercials! It even-numbered them in the top left corner one of five. The same exact feed through my internet router had ZERO commercials. I paid $15 to not be bothered with commercials but yet I get them on Amazon's BETA streaming player! I don't care if it is a beta player. I am not going to be a beta tester after paying nearly $500! This was the final straw for me deciding to return the HDX."Mayday" rep had not heard of, nor had any notification of an Amazon BETA streaming player. Such things are to be expected from large corporations that typically do not inform Customer Service Reps about BETAs or updates. However, even after the rep put me on hold (meaning she was asking someone else), she denied any knowledge of any such "workaround" and suggested I sideload Adobe Flash. I explained I already tried that.From my career as a Level 1, Level 2, and Level 3 CSR and trainer in hardware and software support I know that even the best CSR's will not know everything if they don't think outside of the box and keep asking questions from "veteran" reps and their Systems people. Instead, I received the "I apologize" excuse ad infinitum despite the fact that I told the rep that she had no reason to apologize as it was not her fault that a basic feature expected from all such hardware is sorely lacking in the HDX.6 - If you are used to texting on your phone, type and edit in portrait mode. Typing in landscape is difficult. Swipe is not supported. Every piece of nonsupported software that I try to sideload eventually had glitches and problems trying to run on the HDX.7 - I explained that I could not find a way to change the internet background color on websites in Silk. The white background is hard on my eyes and the screen has a bad glare on it. She hesitated for a moment, checked her screen and advised that there indeed was no way to change it. I now know that changing to "Reader View" allows for font and color changes. The "Mayday" rep was either not sufficiently trained or was not provided hands-on testing after the training; either of which would have solved that problem.8 - As far as the Carousel is concerned, I want the same icons on it every time and I don't want them moving around based on usage frequency. And, adding the first photo from the photo collection to the carousel each and every time I go to photos even if I never looked at that first photo is really annoying. The rep explained that she understood and started to explain my options of deleting or moving each Carousel item. I explained that I already knew this as well as just scrolling the Carousel up to hide it but that lack of simple customization is frustrating.9 - If I attach a photo to an email and then later go out and choose photos from the top menu it brings up the email. Just a tiny bug that can probably be quickly fixed. This should have been caught before rushing this to market but this type of bug is typical for corporations that rush products to market to beat holiday (or other internal) deadlines.10 - Screen glare is bad especially on the Bezel. A color other than white might help the screen background but the only option to change the screen background is while reading a Kindle book or in Silk's "Reading Mode." A black bezel is not recommended for any product if you will be using it in a brightly-lit room or where there is artificial light behind you. I notice no difference from my current laptop's 1680x1050 resolution except my laptop glare is much less.11 -  It is a fingerprint magnet. You need to leave a soft glasses cleaner cloth nearby.12- As almost all people have noticed, there is a pesky backlight issue. At first I thought it was because of the extremely sensitive screen but it makes no difference how long you leave your finger on the screen. Moving from screen to screen causes the screen to change from bright to dim with auto-brightness turned off. The screen is way too dim with auto-brightness turned on.13 - I could not access Kindle book discussions from the book menu. I do not think HDX is a complete "fail" or the software is completely broken but, even as a PRIME, movie-watching member, I can't live with it. You will need time and patience for its learning curve and for software updates if you need to do more than what it was designed for, reading books and watching Prime movies.Last, it was very difficult to hear my "Mayday" rep [name omitted for this review], even with the HDX volume turned all the way up and my home completely quiet. This may also be attributed to either not having her headset adjusted correctly or her non-English accent.  And NO, there is nothing wrong with my hearing! I got the definite impression that she was extremely uncomfortable in her job due to she was not prepared. Hiring bi-lingual reps strictly for their language capabilities and ignoring their lack of customer service experience and lack of communication skills is a Human Resources issue that I strongly suggest Amazon address if they want to keep their "#1 Customer Satisfaction" rating." Finally, when I asked the "Mayday" rep to help start my return process, she again put me on hold and a minute later another (male) rep came on the line. I could hear him saying hello to me but because the original rep left her system on hold, he could not hear me, nor could I see him. He continued to try saying hello to me with my hellos going un-answered for 5 minutes until the connection was lost. My email address was previously confirmed and the first rep accessed my account so they also had my phone number. When a connection is lost, common customer service dictates the rep attempt to contact the customer again. Not here! This experience was the poorest I have ever received from any company in my 30 years of IT experience. Fortunately, Amazon's Returns policy does not require a customer service rep's help and I initiated the return myself online.

Reviews.Title: What can I say????
Reviews.Author: RiverCat
Reviews.Content: I say, Fabulous!  I have to sit in a chair for 3 1/2 hours on M T and W, for dialysis.  My first,generation kindle died;  I bought the top of the line model hoping it would last longer.  It is so easy to use and I have it enclosed in an Origami cover; it sits on its own and needs no prop, just my lap.  The color is so good and I can adjust the size of the font for my”chemo” eyes.  It is just so handy, I love, love it...I even named it Mary in honor of my FB friend who sent me my first Kindle as a gift.  Mary and I go every where together, reading a book, playing a game, searching the web...too cool

Reviews.Title: The Best!
Reviews.Author: sharon Trank
Reviews.Content: I gave a ipad, I bought this for my son for Christmas and he says it's better than my ipad!  Personal preference but I agree that it is strongly made and we gave had no problems what so ever.

Reviews.Title: Great device
Reviews.Author: Barbara A McKinzie
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire is clear, crisp and easy on the eyes.  Great device for color pictures and games, outstanding clarity.

Reviews.Title: Great kindle!
Reviews.Author: Lacey
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mother in law for mothers day and she absolutely loves it! It's very light weight and the screen is awesome!! Very nice!

Reviews.Title: My new favorite
Reviews.Author: sbb
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle I liked my Fire Kindle but the HD is the best!!! Love it love it love it!!

Reviews.Title: My Kindle is quite possibly my soulmate
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "Fosterocalypse"
Reviews.Content: I am in love with my Kindle. It is the best electronic device in my arsenal. Highly recommended. For anyone who loves awesome stuff.

Reviews.Title: Worthwhile Purchase
Reviews.Author: Sweeties Dad
Reviews.Content: I really like the help function. It worked perfectly and was as advertised. Amazing! Size is great and it seems to hold a charge for a long period. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: The Best Thing Since Sliced White Bread!
Reviews.Author: Clear Blue "clearblue"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this thing! It has made my book reading, movie watching, game playing, web searching existence mobile!  I can now take what I love most anywhere! The font is bright and readable with varying sizes to choose from. The battery lasts forever! Well, 12 hrs and somewhat more. I love the origami case which is beyond fabulous because you can form it and it feels like a real book cover! I can take it into the kitchen with me and set it up on the counter so that I can see it while I am preparing a recipe! I love that! Or if I'm into a movie, oh and movies are beautiful on this thing and the sound is the best I've ever heard even better than my Toshiba laptop. When it is near dinner time I can take it with me to the kitchen, prepare dinner and continue watching my movie. It is so light and easy to carry. I really do not see why there are ANY negative reviews on this Kindle Fire HDX 8.9. The apps are awesome and I found some free books on facebook using pixel of ink. People have to be crazy to rate this little jewel any less than five stars. I highly recommend it! You won't be disappointed. Give yourself time to get use to it and learn all its functions. It has a ton!

Reviews.Title: Good but not Great
Reviews.Author: Martin D Waugh
Reviews.Content: Not being able to access so many apps is very frustrating.Not having the freedom to use applications on the Fire severely limits you.Slow response time with the Amazon apps is also surprising and frustratingIf this isn't fixed I will go with another tabletPlease upgrade Amazon! The ability to use other systems only makes your tablet more desirable

Reviews.Title: Good but not Great
Reviews.Author: Martin D Waugh
Reviews.Content: Not being able to access so many apps is very frustrating.Not having the freedom to use applications on the Fire severely limits you.Slow response time with the Amazon apps is also surprising and frustratingIf this isn't fixed I will go with another tabletPlease upgrade Amazon! The ability to use other systems only makes your tablet more desirable

Reviews.Title: the best kindle fire ever
Reviews.Author: Kendall
Reviews.Content: This is my second kindle fire.  I bought the first kindle fire that was made.  I loved that one, but now I have the new 8.9" HDX.  This is the cat's meow!  It is very fast and very clear in video and sound. I would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected.
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HDX is everything I expected plus a whole lot more.  Upon arrival I selected the May day feature for assistance with set up and within five minutes I was up and running.  All my stored items from my old Kindle was there too.  I LOVE IT.

Reviews.Title: Love It!!!
Reviews.Author: twinmom42
Reviews.Content: Had the Kindle Fire HDX 7" but my eyesight is not as good as it used to be so I upgraded to the 8.9".  It is incredible what a difference the size makes.  I thought it might be a little heavier given the larger size but it is about the same and it still fits in my purse.  I wish I had purchased this to begin with!  Great device with awesome Amazon service.

Reviews.Title: Amazon does it again!
Reviews.Author: jkl.
Reviews.Content: I received my first Kindle as a gift and thought it could not get any better.  I was hesitant to upgrade to the newer HDX and larger display.  Once it arrived, all doubt was gone.  Lighter, clearer display, great features.  Toss the laptop and other cumbersome gadgets.  This has everything I need.

Reviews.Title: love it.
Reviews.Author: gekmikey
Reviews.Content: Perfect for what i need to use.  Only thing isnot having google play. Have had no problems. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: so. awesome
Reviews.Author: happyin2son
Reviews.Content: I have gone from original Fire to HD Fire to HDX. I really like the bigger screen. I don't like the change in orientation in Words with Friends. I really like reading my email on the HDX.

Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL device!
Reviews.Author: TucsonSusan
Reviews.Content: I must confess that I am a Kindle fanatic, and this is my fourth one, and it is, for me, by far the best one I own. It has everything I want:  a great screen that makes reading in any kind of light possible; crisp, clear books and apps; web-browsing; all my Netflix and Amazon Prime videos at my fingertips. It is lightweight and feels good in my hand. It fits into all but my smallest bags (and that one is about big enough for a wallet and keys). I am certain that it is as good as the iPad mini at about half the price. Playing games and using apps is even better than before, with brilliant color and blazing fast speed. I generally don't leave home without it, and consider it one of the best technology investments I've ever made. Now I am looking for good homes for its predecessors.The improvements over the first Kindle Fire are obvious and outstanding. There is an added bonus of "most highlighted sections" in every book. The size and weight are streamlined. The screen is glare-free and the graphics are rendered beautifully. It has an 8 mp camera which I haven't experimented with yet, but I will, eventually, and I am sure I will be happy with that. I cannot say enough positive things about this device, and thousands of reviewers before me have said it all.BUY THIS. You will not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: it my dream and now i love it..
Reviews.Author: Abu Omar
Reviews.Content: A long time a go I was looking to have like this device and since I bought kindle fire HDX I got what I'm looking for. Firstly, I am an international student and I came to the United states in the end of 2011. When I start my education at Champlain college since 6/30/2016 I read many books in English and not easy for an international student to read a book in foreign language. So, this device support translate books as well as read those books to us. One the other, hand the price much cheaper as we getting a huge benefit from it. Yesterday I did a test for this device on it battery. Then, I got this results ,, I got 40 percent to charge the battery on 78 minutes = 100 percent on 3 hours and 25 minutes. In addition, it stay work not less then 11 hours reading with leasing. This device support education much and much, so I recommend for those who intereste to get the education in an advance way. Very good idea when you get a kindle fire which a large company like Amazon stand behind it. Amazon much familiar with online bookstore as the first in this field in the world,, . In this time Amazon represents a biggest market in the world which you can access on it in your small device like kindle. Finally, kindle fire HDX more greater then I thought about it before I bought it. Thank you Amazon you make my dream is true.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product with some easily solvable flaws
Reviews.Author: Bruce A. Pearson
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th or 5th Kindle.  I bought it because of the prime video download feature which works great!  Two limits that need fixing though- it needs more ram.  I am constantly running into ram limitations.  Also, while Amazon allows a generous 25 download limit on prime videos, since I lost my previous Kindle HD with 8 downloads on it, those count against my 25 limit ... deregistering the lost Kindle does NOT solve the issue.  I have called Amazon customer service several times on this, there is no solution.  So I am essentially limited to 18 downloads.

Reviews.Title: Thank you
Reviews.Author: Jasmyne
Reviews.Content: I picked my Kindle up from the Post Office.  I love it... Now I looking for a real neat cover for my Kindle. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: KIndle Fire HDX 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Joyce S, Spence
Reviews.Content: I wanted a tablet for some time and all the Christmas ads drove me insane!  Finally a day or so before Christmas, my husband told me to order what I wanted.  It took some time to arrive, but was well worth the wait!  I am also a PRIME member, so the free streaming content, free books, and lending library have been wonderful complements. The pictures are so sharp and the colors so vivid!  I worried about the ads, but they are completely unobtrusive.  In fact, I have actually taken advantage of several of them.  My kindle holds a charge for a two or three days, a big improvement over my smart phone or mini computer.  All in all, this has been one of my better purchase decisions!

Reviews.Title: my new kindle
Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: I had the original Kindle and I had some issues with it, however everything is A,O.K. with this one.  I love it, when my granddaughter comes over it's the first think she asks for, can I play with your kindle? She loves it too.

Reviews.Title: I Love It Love it Love It
Reviews.Author: dray
Reviews.Content: I am actually glad they made me choose this one. I would not have been as happy with the old style as I am with this one.dra

Reviews.Title: I'm a fan of Amazon
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I did my homework on the options I wanted for the price. As far as the movies, the amount of movies to download if you are a prime member for offline viewing is limited and the movies are older movies. However, there is a vast amount of movies to watch while you are online. As well at t.v. shows, etc. I signed up for the prime membership to get the most use out of my Kindle Fire. The graphics are great, download speeds are fast, and cloud storage is great! I also love the lending library, many great titles available for free! As well as all of the regular titles that Amazon offers for free! I do not have any issues with apps not being availble from the play store, Amazon has a great many apps available. I love the cloud storage because I do not have to use up my kindle space to store my books, movies, pictures, or any other items.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9", HDX Display, Wi-Fi, 16 GB
Reviews.Author: Kathryn Diamond
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet.  It is everything that I was looking for in a tablet and more.  It is so bright and everything is crystal clear on it and I just love using it.  I sure do recommend it to everyone.  The Apple IPad might be the in thing but you can get the same things on this Kindle Fire as the IPad and it is cheaper and so much nicer.  I love the "Live" person that is on there to help when you need it.  I had to use it for the first time, just a few days ago, and it was awesome.  She walked me right through everything that I needed help with.  I recommend this product to everyone who is just contemplating buying a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Faster than the previous Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Donna J. Kelley
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews and finally decided to upgrade to the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" Wi-Fi.  I'm so glad that I did, because now I can sit in my living room and download content without getting dropped and I can play games on it without it freezing and taking forever to upload. I'm very happy with my purchase and would recommend it to anyone that is thinking of upgrading to this generation.  There's only one draw back really, that if you upgrade to 4G and you aren't currently going through AT&T; or Verizon for your internet, that you would have to pay for this service.  Since 4G is not currently available in the area I live in, it made perfect sense to go with Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: As Advertized
Reviews.Author: 1st Sgt
Reviews.Content: Putting out over $350 was a hard decision for this cash-strapped retired person.  I have the $69 Kindle, and had it loaded up with books.  When my new Kindle arrived, I registered it, and all my books transferred over automatically...something I was worried.  I did have a problem with signing into Kiva, a micro finance institution.  I pushed the "Help" button, and in 5 seconds there was a gal on my screen asking, "How can I help you".  I told her my problem.  She did some kind of hokey poky inside my Kindle, then asked me to try to sign in.  Bingo..it works just fine.  What a great feature, what a great device!  Faster downloading apps and internet pages than my Galaxy S3.  Enjoy yours.

Reviews.Title: Christmas Gift of Kindle
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I am just crazy about my Kindle Fire HDX.  I also signed up for Kindle Prime and I watched my first free movie last night.  I am so glad I asked for the Kindle.  I also added the Yahoo App for weather and have set up a few cities and check them everyday.  Of course, I have downloaded quite a few books already.  I just can't express in enough words how much I enjoy my Kindle HDX.  I ran into a small problem in regards to searching for movies and I called Amazon and Mary Ann walked me through it in 5 minutes.  Great customer service from a very nice lady.

Reviews.Title: MY HUSBAND IS JEALOUS OF MY KINDLE LOVE AFFAIR....LOL!!!
Reviews.Author: Victoria Mendez
Reviews.Content: I have become a hardcore Kindle freak.... and now I have two...one 7inch hdx and one 8.9inch hdx....Love em both....I'm a nurse so the 7inch hdx I use for work and the 8.9 hdx is for having fun at home. I'm a reader and a movie buff so the so called "closed" system of Kindle isn't an issue for me. Any google app I have on my android I have either successfully  found on kindle's system or found a satisfactory or BETTER replacement for it....seriously the best tablet anywhere for those who don't require a windows os. The screen resoulution is AMAZING....I'm a prime member too so I have TONS of free movies to watch....the speed is lightening fast and no freezing issues as some have experienced. I love AMAZON....who ever owns this company...."WAY TO GO!!!! I HOPE YOU BECOME A BILLIONAIRE BECAUSE YOUR SERVICES, PRODUCTS AND COMMITMENT TO EXELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE ACTUALLY MAKE PEOPLE'S LIVES BETTER" XXOO ;-)

Reviews.Title: Awesome device
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I purchased it as a gift and she can't put it down.  Between having all her books and the other internet apps, its constantly in use.  A solid tablet that is focused on her primary love of books.  A winner.

Reviews.Title: Needs a manual
Reviews.Author: Jolene B. Davis
Reviews.Content: I'm amazed at what the Kindle can do, but wish it had come with a paperback manual.  I checked out a book from the library called Kindle Fire: the missing manual, the book that should have been in the box.  It has helped tremendously.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: carmen c. rivera
Reviews.Content: it's easy to use and small enough to take anywhere yet large enough screen to enjoy it. husband loves it as i bought for him my PC was a bit much but somehow the Kindle is not so intimidating as the large PC i use.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: diana vanduinen
Reviews.Content: I purchased three kindles in December for gifts for my husband and two children.  The picture quality is amazing. They love them..

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9
Reviews.Author: terry
Reviews.Content: Have old Kindle but the 7 inch screen was not big enough. was looking for some thing more decided on the HDX 8.9 glad I did love it. Movies are great on it.

Reviews.Title: Loking for the best tablet/e-reader then look no further.
Reviews.Author: Jacque Bagwell "IamLuved"
Reviews.Content: I have three Kindles now and I have to say this Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" is the very best. I've used my parents iPad before but I wouldn't trade my Kindles for anything in the world. My Kindles are my most treasured possessions. If you're looking for the best tablet/e-reader on the market then a Kindle HDX is a MUST!

Reviews.Title: How do you love something more?
Reviews.Author: Tourman "I'm a 4th generation native of Eurek...
Reviews.Content: I loved my 1st generation Kindle Fire - 7" so how do I describe how I love my new HDX 8.9 even more? I just do! It's faster, bigger, yet not too big, it's sharper, thinner, lighter, better sounding, very easy to set up and I love the voice recognition capability. I am a big user of that feature on my cell phone and really missed it on the original Kindle Fire. I am 55 years old and have a 55 inch Samsung TV, yet I find myself watching more and more movies and programs on my HDX 8.9. I guess when you're in love you really can't find anything bad to say about the object of your affection. So, I will leave it at that!

Reviews.Title: Love, Love, Love It!
Reviews.Author: Deena Jemery
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire.  It is so much fun and so versatile.  Don't know why I waited so long to get one.  Easy to set up (almost no real effort involved) and use it daily.Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: It is very easy to use and video is great I would recommend it to any one. Reading books is easy on the eyes.

Reviews.Title: Changed Views on Kindle
Reviews.Author: Shannon E.
Reviews.Content: Love this product...I had no desire for a tablet type system and when I reviewed the special offer and read up on the he Kindle Fire I thought I would try it...great visual and sound as well as being handy on the go. Battery life is great as well. I charge every night so I don't know how long it will go without charge but I watched 2 movies at hospital stay accessed FB, checked email and played a couple of games to pass the time and it never went below 50% battery life.

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: NancyK
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my (grown) granddaughter for Christmas. She was thrilled!  Her Facebook post read something like "status coming to you from my new Kindle Fire HDX.  It's amazing!  And my Mimi spoils me!"  She's right, I do.

Reviews.Title: Love it but...
Reviews.Author: LUV2READ
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal customer. This is my 4th kindle and I am pleased. However, the ONLY thing that bugs me is I have to reboot my kindle way too much in order for it to work properly. Even when my WiFi bar is at full strength(5bars)!  A few times I couldn't hear the rep from Maytag. But overall, it's lighter, thinner and the Maytag feature is a cool addition. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE my new Kindle!!!!!
Reviews.Author: galtex
Reviews.Content: My original Kindle Fire, bought in 2011, is still going strong, but the new Kindle HDX 8.9" is awesome!!!I have clicked on the "mayday" button and both Nancy and Molly were both patient and helpful.  Thanks for another great product.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: John Zion
Reviews.Content: I love it so far. It does everything all the other tablets do, and at a great price compared to others. I need to find other stuff to do on it to justify my need to play with it more.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: Gail Sims
Reviews.Content: I purchased the kindle fire 7" about three years ago.  I upgraded to the kindle fire HDX 8.9 this Christmas.  The difference in amazingly wonderful.  Thanks for a great tablet at a low price.

Reviews.Title: Just what I thought it would be,
Reviews.Author: Leonard D. Jompulsky
Reviews.Content: An exceptionally fine tablet. Great vivid colors, light weight and fun to use and easy to navigate.Very happy that my children bought this for me.

Reviews.Title: i like it very much, the display is very clearly, process is so fast. the Mayday function is wonderful.
Reviews.Author: shi guo ping
Reviews.Content: it's perfect and better than ipad mini.the price is more competitive.also the service for Amazon is the best of all(Mayday is wonderful)

Reviews.Title: My new Kindle HDX
Reviews.Author: Diva45
Reviews.Content: I just love my new Kindle HDX 8.9, I already own the Kindle Fire HD 32GB "7". It's easy to use, & I just love Amazon, I'm really excited that I now have a rear camera, cause I just love taking pictures. It's very light easy to use, I'm trying to get use to how fast it goes. Anyone who don't have one please purchase one it's really something you and the whole family can used.

Reviews.Title: Ongoing problems
Reviews.Author: BillFL
Reviews.Content: The resolution is excellent, response times very good.Problem: intermittently unit stopped with the blue screen of death; upon rebooting blue screen still displayed; after several minutes unit would reboot but reboot extremely slow.Occasionally, when using back arrow unit aborted with totally black screen; same reboot problem.Tech support made assurances fix would be downloaded; did not happenStill some hidden bugs in the overall system

Reviews.Title: I am a happy camper!
Reviews.Author: H. McCaddin
Reviews.Content: I have only had this for a few days, but I love it! The battery is long lasting so far, but haven't watched movies or anything yet. It was a breeze to get set up and going. Very user friendly and so skinny! I have yet to have an issue with it. Will add to review if something negative pops up in the future. Am very happy now!

Reviews.Title: Near perfection
Reviews.Author: tim
Reviews.Content: Probably the best tablet out there.  Many positives but only two negatives really.The screen looks great.  The size and weight are perfect.  The battery lasts a really really long time.  Definitely the smoothest and fastest tablet I've used.  It just falls short in two areas.  The price is $379.99 which is probably about $100 too much and for one reason really.  Which leads us into the other negative, it only has access to the amazon store and not Google Play.Now again let me reiterate.  At doing web browsing and kindle things it is fantastic.  But if you wanted to play games or access to any app out there it falls short.

Reviews.Title: KindleFire Better than IPAD mini
Reviews.Author: HS
Reviews.Content: For the price and features I believe I will recommend buying this compared to the IPAD mini which I have. The only feature that i did not like about, which is not a big deal, is its restarting all over again if you have turned on the off wireless feature.Has software and hardware that makes it easy to print out and view docs. No technical details.Space is enough.

Reviews.Title: simply awesome
Reviews.Author: Steven rivas
Reviews.Content: this was Super fast and it had an excellent interface and easy to use.  I willl certainly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: Heidi Argyle
Reviews.Content: I have tried several tablets and am always frustrated with slowness/loading time. This tablet is super fast and the hd is superb.The whole family loves it and it gets passed from person to person all day long! I also really love the kindle free time for the kids as we can control how much time is spent on games and focus them toward books as well to help improve their reading. :)

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I finally decided that it was time to upgrade my Kindle Fire (original 7" version - not HD), which I loved.  In fact, it still works.  My son inherited it.Anyway, I was ready for something bigger, faster, able to do more, but not as heavy or big as my laptop.  So, I started researching, and quickly narrowed the field down to either the Lenovo Yoga Tab 10 (my laptop is a Yoga 13, which I LOVE) or the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9.  I had just about decided to save the $100 and get the Yoga, but there were a few things that kept nagging at me on some of the reviews.  The Yoga's processor lagged when it tried to do too much, the screen resolution was sub-par compared to other 10-inch tablets - those were the big two.So, finally, I bit the bullet and spent the extra money for the Fire HDX 8.9 - and I'm SO glad I did.This machine is so much faster than my old Kindle Fire, and pretty much anything else I've tried.  The screen is big, bright and crisp, making graphics just jump out at you.  The speakers are wonderful - loud and clear  The Wi-Fi works very well.  I have had no issues connecting to my network, even all the way across the house - meaning the signal has to travel through at least 5 walls.The battery holds up pretty well for me.  I have had the tablet for 8 days, and it is just now charging for the second time.  As a caveat, I have been at work for much of that 8 days, but I'm pretty sure that even on my off week, I should get 2 days per charge or so.  Now, I also bought a 11,000 mAh external battery pack at the same time I bought this, and I HIGHLY recommend the one I bought ( B00DUTVOU8 ).  I would really love a bigger battery (or a case with built-in battery), but it works just fine as-is.I have a co-worker who is an Apple aficionado, and he was impressed by the picture and sound quality.  We compared it to his iPad Air - and the Kindle was better in both picture and sound quality.Overall, I have nothing bad to say about this machine. I absolutely love it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 Wi-Fi 16 GB
Reviews.Author: Shorian "gadget guru"
Reviews.Content: Kudos to Amazon for quarterly installment payments on the Kindle. I wouldn't have been able to buy it otherwise. I am sure that the HDX will be discounted at some point next year after the holiday season. But even so, it will be a major purchase if I had to pay for it all at once.I owned a Kindle 8.9 HD which I recently sold to purchase the HDX. The HDX is a tremendous improvement over the older model in nearly every aspect. The display is brighter and clearer. Performance is very snappy. Setup was easy. I use MS Outlook for my email and all I had to do was provide my password. The Kindle app handled all the server setup automatically.I love the dual cameras, especially the new rear facing one. It has an LED flash and image stabilization, a great improvement. I also love the new voice recognition feature. I use this feature all the time on my Nexus 7 to dictate email and do searches. This helps someone like myself who has arthritis. For me, this was the main selling point.I haven't needed the new live help yet, but I am curious how well it works. I know I will eventually try it to satisfy my curiosity.Games and video play very smoothly, unlike the previous model that tended to freeze up at times. The speed difference is very noticeable.It is also noticeably lighter than the previous model. My arm and hand don't get tired from holding it to read.At this point, I don't know what Amazon could do to top this model.

Reviews.Title: Must have it
Reviews.Author: pezman
Reviews.Content: I have had this Fire HDX since day 1It has a beautiful picture.I also have a Samsung note 10 but the HDX has a better display.

Reviews.Title: Exellent product
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Diesen
Reviews.Content: With this offer I tried the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9  It is a excellent unit we use it everyday for internet access, movies, apps, everything. The display quality is superior, watching a movie is awesome.  The size of unit is perfect not to big not to small my 3 year old grandson can even navigate through using Kindle Free Time which is a huge success at our house it allows me to choose what content and for how long and does not give him the freedom to go to internet access. It runs smoothly and is easy to set up and navigate through. I will be keeping this unit and it is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Just gotta say Wow!
Reviews.Author: Frugal Shopper "BunellaZoe"
Reviews.Content: so far I can't find anything negative to say about this tablet.  I already had the Fire HD 8.9 and was in love with that but this is even better.Better on/off button (i kept turning the old one off when i was trying to raise/lower the volume).  Also better volume buttons.The camera is so cool, I'm taking pictures of my husband while he's dozing in his recliner cause he thinks I'm watching Amazon Prime Videos (which I am also).  The picture is gorgeous, the sound I think is Dolby.Set up was so easy since I already have a Kindle account and everything that was on my old Kindle was in the Cloud somewhere and now it's on the new one.  For the wifi all I did was input the password for my home network and i was connected.I've only had it one day, so i'll come back and follow up in a month or so.

Reviews.Title: Even better than the HD
Reviews.Author: Shana Clemens
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Kindle Fire. I was excited to get the new HDX after learning it had a better battery life, quad core processor, and is much lighter. Finally, I don't have charge my Kindle every day. It is much faster than the HD and the scrolling is noticeably smoother. I am thrilled with my HDX and glad I didn't wait to get it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9", HDX Display, Wi-Fi, 16 GB - Includes Special Offers
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Twigg
Reviews.Content: So far my wife really likes it and has given me permission to dispose of her 1st generation iPad to help defray the cost of HER Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant
Reviews.Author: Gregory Bleeker Jr.
Reviews.Content: The "Mayday Button" is awesome, within 5 seconds I had someone on my screen both times I pushed it, it helps having an Amazon Prime account if you plan on buying this...Not as featuresque as the iPad Air which I have also, but it can come pretty close at times...

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hdx
Reviews.Author: thomas
Reviews.Content: I've been reading a kindle for a very long time.  Have read over 300 books on my old kindle.  Just decided to order the new kindle fire.  It has definitely exceeded my expectations.  I've recommended the kindle fire to all my friends and my book club.  It's awesome!

Reviews.Title: Love it (with a few complaints)
Reviews.Author: LUCY EARHART
Reviews.Content: This was given to me as a gift and I love it!  I had a Nook color that was smaller and more bulky.  This is slim and easy to use.  I only have three small complaints.  One:  I don't like where they placed the plugin for the charger on the device.  Two:  There should be more font size options for books.  There are only two and the Nook had several.  Three:  So far, there is only one option for a case and that is the origami case.  It doubles the weight because it is a heavy duty case and I don't like the way you have to maneuver it to get it to a standing position.  Other then those three small complaints, I love it!!!

Reviews.Title: It is light weighted and has two cameras
Reviews.Author: Margaret A. Gourdine
Reviews.Content: I like it.  It is much lighter that the original Kindle so you can take it with you without being weighted down.  I also like that I can take pictures with it instead of also having to take a camera with me also.

Reviews.Title: The new Kindle Fire 8.9" HDX
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: best Kindle ever! The display just pops out at you. The new Silk is a great improvement. Mayday is a nice feature. The display for reading as bright and clear. The new thinner design makes it much easier to hold while reading. I think this was an excellent investment.

Reviews.Title: HDX everything I wanted and more.
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I have been using the original kindle for about two years now.  The Fire HDX blows that one one away.  I can do so much more.  The HDX has a brilliant screen, great sound, and very user friendly.

Reviews.Title: YAY! SO Pretty!
Reviews.Author: Metalette
Reviews.Content: After years of being single, I think I want to marry my new Kindle HDX 8.9.... *sigh* Love at first sight.

Reviews.Title: HDX Dream Machine
Reviews.Author: nedjinski
Reviews.Content: It's hard not to give this thing 5 stars - I was an early Kindle Fire adopter - I had the first edition KF 7" , then the 8.9 HD, and now the 8.9 HDX. The evolution of this device has been amazing. With each iteration I was highly impressed, but none more so than this new HDX - it is simply incredible - very fast, very smooth, light weight, super sharp screen graphics. I can't imagine these things being exponentially better in a year or two.I would like it if it were more of a device open to the rest of the world - meaning it would run all apps in the google play store seamlessly - but it does what it does very, very well.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Quality tablet for reading/web browsing.
Reviews.Author: LostITGuy
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Kindle Fire HDX as the kindle versions of books I needed were $120+ cheaper.  As far as the HDX unit itself, I've been very impressed with the build quality and construction.  My unit does not exhibit the blue tinge that I've read about in other reviews, and backlight quality is phenomenal.  I use my HDX primarily for reading and web browsing, and both have been very enjoyable on the unit.  Both Kindle books and PDFs look absolutely gorgeous on the 2560x1600 screen (even older scanned texts).  I ended up purchasing the 8.9" as the 7" screen was too small for me.  Web browsing with the silk browser also looks great although there is stuttering on some bloated pages (I have not tried side-loading the Google Play store and using chrome yet).  Overall I'm very happy with my purchase and can definitely recommend the unit to anyone using it primarily for web browsing/reading.As far as the special offers, they only show up on the home/lock screen and are not annoying.  I haven't paid to remove them as they really have not bothered me (and I've been lazy)

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX8.9  Simply Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: D. L. Blair "reader"
Reviews.Content: It's the best tablet out there.  Has many great features and is really slick.  Highly recommended.  I really love it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Kindle
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: This kindle is amazing! I bought it for my wife for Christmas. She loves it! It works as advertised. It is easy to use. Instructions are easy to follow. Start up was fast and easy. It is a great product with plenty storage. My wife loves the many available apps and software and books.

Reviews.Title: SHOULD have been better
Reviews.Author: M. Seroczynski
Reviews.Content: I've spent a lot of time over the last three days searching, working, and "fighting" with my new Kindle Fire 8.9 HDX (I also have first generation iPad). I was really intrigued by the hardware (primarily the display) and lower price than the competing "Air" product.I am very impressed how cool it runs (but I have not tried to play games with it and the display's brightness is turned down) and it has not crashed even once. Also, the battery is good for many hours of lightweight use.>I probably would have returned it by now, but I've found a couple of very good applications that I would like to continue to use: CalenGoo and Polaris Office (I don't think spending a few hundred dollars on just a "content viewer" is such a good idea), so I will probably keep it.>I keep discovering user interface issues. I have just discovered a problem with Kindle's PDF reader where I was unable to exit the reader when viewing a single-page PDF (would not display any "soft" buttons/icons and there is no hardware "home" or "exit" button). Apparently there is no way to empty "email trash" other than selecting each and every deleted email first (!). There seem to be NO WAY to place photos in collections or folders (I've created folders with a file explorer but they were ignored). I am just wandering who wrote the software...>So far, I have not been able to set up the Kindle calendar (this just amazed me). It wanted me to synchronize with an existing online calendar of some sort, but I don't have one. It will NOT work in a stand-alone mode and, apparently, it will not store it's data in Amazon's Cloud either. With "CalenGoo," I created a few Google calendars (as it recommended), and so far it is working very well.>I was able to open, edit, and save older versions of Microsoft Excel files with "Polaris Office," but it does not work with Google Drive. I used a file explorer to transfer files from-and-to Google drive and then I moved them from-to another subfolder on the Kindle; it was doable but unnecessarily tedious.>The often bad-mouthed Silk Browser has worked quite well (but I've turned the "acceleration" off); the only problem I've discovered so far was NASA's Astronomy Picture of the Day (APOD) site (disappointing).>A fact that the user cannot change the screen backgrounds (login and "desktop") is astonishing...The included user guide is too basic. I've just bought an e-book to solve that problem.>Amazon does not allow access to Google Play, which has some applications that are either newer or even not-available in the Amazon's App Store. I have also discovered that a lot of the available applications I was looking for (productivity and utilities) have poor users' ratings.>It would have not bothered me that there was no easy way to connect to Google Drive directly if Amazon offered a similar functionality. For example, not allowing storage of calendar data in IT'S OWN "cloud" totally amazed me (unless I am missing something here or I am just having a bad dream).I think, the Kindle Fire has a great potential; Amazon just needs more ambition to go beyond the reader-viewer-listener-shopper business model, or sell them for half price so we can buy multiple tablets for different purposes.Please report all shortcomings to Amazon, so the software can be improved (hopefully soon).>For clarity sake, I am a long time, "loyal" Amazon's customer.==============================================================================================For people new to Kindle Fire 2013 (now or in the near future), I recommend this e-book by Michael J. Young: "Kindle Fire: The Complete Guidebook - For Your Kindle Fire HDX and HD, Second Edition"==============================================================================================I've tested three PDFs with OfficeSuite Professional: no problems.

Reviews.Title: NOT GOOD EXPERIENCE AT ALL
Reviews.Author: marie leslie "Les"
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get this and all the options that it had for movies, books, gaming etc. However when it came it took over an hour to download the software. When I choose some frees games it would not download them. I could not watch movies they would just buffer. I called Mayday and the connection did not hold and the man did not seem to know anything technical. He turned me over tokindle support. I was not offered any real technical support. I tried to inquire if a certain amount of broad band was needed and she said you don't have enough. You can return it so I did. Later I called again to see about another device and I was told that the HDX did not need certain broadband requirements. No one really offered to trouble shoot the situations and I could hardly understand the person helping me. She did not seem to fully understand my questions and seemed like she was reading from a script saying the same thing over and over. I was not only disappointed in the HDX I was even more disappointed at the support which seemed really non-existent. I called again to inquire about the HD after all I am not going to spend over $400 if I can only read and no one can answer how that would work. So I am really writing this to see if Amazon reads these and if they really care about how their staff responds to problems.

Reviews.Title: Excellent performance but...
Reviews.Author: Atomtraveler
Reviews.Content: I like the Kindle, because I have an Amazon Prime account and enjoy reading.  It does have a decent amount of apps.  But if your expecting the availability of apps similar to what Android or Apple has, then the Kindle may not be for you.  The size and weight of the Kindle HDX 8.9 is great, very lightweight.  I use mine with just a skin as protection.  The screen on the Kindle is its strong point, absolutely great for watching videos or reading books, superior to Apple or Android in my opinion.  The battery life so far has been great, for my usage.  But like any other tablet, it depends on how much you use it and what you use it for. Have yet to use the mayday feature, mostly because I haven't had the need to yet, which is a good thing.  Disappointed in Amazons epub reader selection, and they make it somewhat difficult to place your own epub books or documents from a source other than Amazon.  So, if you have an Amazon Prime account, and use it often, then this is a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: i like it
Reviews.Author: melody worley
Reviews.Content: it is so much lighter. it fits in my purse. i think it is just sexy... i am so happy i traded in for the new model.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: Brilliant colors, very responsive.  The Mayday button is a great feature.  I have only used it twice, but it looks and works just as it does in the ads.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Jerry J. Sechrist
Reviews.Content: We are so pleased with our purchase of the Kindle Fire HDX.  We highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Jury is still out on this one.
Reviews.Author: TeriS
Reviews.Content: I just recently upgraded from the original Kindle Fire version to the lovely, larger HDX version. It seems that certain online videos, as well as some of the apps react/stream so much slower on the new Kindle than in the old one. Also...there seems to be a bright red pixel type burn area only noticeable when the screen goes briefly blank when opening or closing apps. Not noticeable when I'm actually within an app. Will call on the weird red spot...other than that...dunno. Just seems much slower instead of faster.

Reviews.Title: Bad, bad, bad
Reviews.Author: Darlene Johnson
Reviews.Content: I was so looking forward to the Fire HDX with all the hype about how wonderful it was, got it set it up charged the battery to 100%...next day the battery was at 11% and I hadn't even USED it for anything....so I charged it AGAIN to 100% and powered it off completely....the next day it wouldn't even turn on! Okay, so maybe I got a bad one, I contacted Amazon and they didn't even offer a replacement...just said send it back and they would refund my money....go figure! After reading more reviews here I'm thinking there are MAJOR issues with the batteries in these so beware. And just for the record, I have 4 Kindles, including the 1st generation and all of my Granddaughters and my daughter and her boyfriend have various ones and so far this is by far the WORSE one I have owned and it cost the MOST!

Reviews.Title: Kudos to Kindle
Reviews.Author: James Larsen
Reviews.Content: Despite all the jealous sniping from devotees of a certain fruit pad, I find the kindle to be a rather able platform; especially with some android side loading (very easily done).  I got the 32 gig 8.9 incher and have only managed to fill up 4 gigs, and I have a few dozen apps and over 220 e-books on it (mostly in large part still on amazon servers, ie the cloud).  The sound is loud enough that everyone in the room can hear when someone reads to us from the 2 able speakers on the tablet, but I wish it were just a tad bit louder.  It is louder than my 16 inch notepad speakers.  Amazon whisper sync is the cat's meow for starting a book on my HP laptop and finishing it sometimes on the tablet or vice versa.  This tablet is overkill for my wife's reading needs, but I am enjoying it's other features.  I have 3 browsers on it and 2 readers, and the pixel count exceeds that of most apps and games,  so it should be a photographers delight. The 8 mp camera takes the best pics compared to a certain fruiti pad.I hope the screen is gorilla glass; so far so good.  Stays charged a long time also.  The reflexes and speed  on the kindle exceed those of a cheetah, no gripes there.  I have no gripes about the wifi.  I do find that the auto brightness can be distracting, so I turn that off most of the time.  I discovered quite by accident that it has sleep mode and Off, and no instructions about that unless I do some internet research.  It's really simple to use.  Sleep mode is a power sipper.  I can charge it from way low to over 90% in about 2 hours with the handy dandy wall wart and usb plug.  It's bright enough to read even  under my 2x4 foot skylight, which is pretty darn bright.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hdx 8.9
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love the hdx 8.9.  I does everything I want it to do.  It is light but powerful. I have compared it to other tables and the kindle just comes out ahead of the others.  I have already recommended it to my family and friends and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: hdx 8.9 is great
Reviews.Author: AnnD
Reviews.Content: I love the new kindle fire hex 8.9 but wish it had adobe flash player.  And some things I want to stream don't work.

Reviews.Title: Like the Fire HD a lot
Reviews.Author: K P Lierz
Reviews.Content: Like the HD. Like the back lite, makes easy to read in poor/no lite. Like the access of cloud holds many more books than will ever read.

Reviews.Title: very happy with kindle fire hdx 8.9
Reviews.Author: Lisa B.
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my purchase.  I have had it about one month.  I had an earlier version of the kindle fire.  I like the larger screen.  While it is bigger than the old one, it is not as heavy and it is still small enough to take it with me when I leave home. I have used the May day option twice; my "how to" questions were answered very quickly.  They walked me through the procedure.

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality
Reviews.Author: lillivun
Reviews.Content: I loved the color and good quality.  VERY well fitted around on/off, adaptor outlets and open and close auto shutdowns.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Kristin Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: The best of the best. Superior in its class and I will never use up all the storage this beast has. Love my kindle. I never leave home without it.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Liz
Reviews.Content: It meets all of my expectations.  I let my son-in-law use it and he loved it as well so my daughter got him one.

Reviews.Title: My new Kindle
Reviews.Author: Kindle'n 4 life
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the kindle. I now use it for most of my reading and surfing. It is awesome.It is the best kindle out there.

Reviews.Title: Kindle HDX 8.9
Reviews.Author: Deegal "Deegal"
Reviews.Content: What's not to love?  Even has that wonderful little live person who comes on the screen to help you.  Great features and fits in my purse but still has a nice size screen.

Reviews.Title: Beest tablt
Reviews.Author: Diana L. Lillar
Reviews.Content: I use it at various meetings and to take notes, and minutes. Love the size and the portability. Awesome Appstore and software.

Reviews.Title: In Love With My Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Micky "Micky @My Book Habit"
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire HDX 8.9. It's much lighter and thinner than my last Kindle Fire, so it's much more portable. I can slip this one in my purse and not worry about it weighing it down.With each version Amazon keeps getting better and better. They have added new text-to-speech narrators and other awesome features which is great. I wouldn't trade my Kindle for a thing.

Reviews.Title: Not a fair rating, but
Reviews.Author: PLEASANT L LINDSEY
Reviews.Content: I want to give it 4.5 stars but Amazon's system won't let you do that.  I've almost stopped reading paper books completely because of the convenience of this tablet.  Interestingly it can do so much more, but I'm so impressed by the the onscreen book reproductions and the unit's available storage that reading is the only thing I use it for anyway.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle Upgrade
Reviews.Author: charlene
Reviews.Content: So far I have been very pleased with my Kindle Fire HDX. I haven't tried to link my Reader's Digest subscription to it yet.  I hope I won't have any problems doing that.

Reviews.Title: OMG.....LOVE IT...../
Reviews.Author: michelle
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle....Started out with the no bells plain old read a book, then I ventured out and started looking at the Kindle HD Iv'e had a blast with that. then comes the HDX, this has got to be the best yet, it's light does everything they say and more....I am still playing with it, have so much to learn. One thing I wish I would have read on here is about the mirrowing your movies....if you do not have a newer model TV then you need to buy a Devise to stream the movies through. I dont mind but wish I would have known sooner so as I could have bought what I needed then. I'll up date as I learn more when I have the time.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for flying
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: As some one who travels quite a bit for work being able to download and watch a bunch of moves and tv shows, including HBO shows, and play them offline makes it worth the cost alone.

Reviews.Title: suprised
Reviews.Author: shorty
Reviews.Content: There's more to it than I thought.  I'm loving the May day! I need a lot of help as I am not electronically inclined.  The battery lasts way longer than my Kindle Fire, so my big decision now is, should I use the Fire for reading or music or....should I use the HDX  for that or visa versa(sp) .  And which one should I use for games?  I  receive and send email, check FB on HDX and much more.  As the saying goes, "I'm lovin' it!"

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Betty J Rector
Reviews.Content: I love this Kindle. It is so powerful and user friendly. The clarity is awesome. I had the first generation Kindle Fire prior to this and am so pleased with this upgrade.

Reviews.Title: Astounding
Reviews.Author: Jose Artur Lobo
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" Fast downloading, excellent picture quality. Transaction was fast, dispatch was very fast. Great!

Reviews.Title: Great device even better when I could root
Reviews.Author: Jim D. Combs
Reviews.Content: Love the display on this device. Have an IPad Air and IPad 3Gen and love the res and video on the Kindle HDX more than I do the Retina on the IPads. Both are nice, but for me the Kindle gets the edge. Have an Amazon Prime account so that makes being locked down, in with the Kindle tolerable. Makes being limited in my droid choices tolerable. I really loved this puppy when I had it rooted and got out of the box could pick and play with Droid. Still a great device that I love. Use it for reading and video on the road, SOHO, and at home. Had to go with ATT for the mobile service, cell, and it sucks as usual in my area, but you live with what you have. Out of the mountains ATT service isn't as frustrating. Great device and worth the price. Use it for movies and books, a great front as I say  for Amazon services especially if you go Prime and definitely get the ad free unit.

Reviews.Title: Love It!!!
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Enjoying every bit of it.  Should have bought this sooner, have been enjoying it even though our WiFi system out here is sub-standard.  Couldn't have made a better investment.  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Moving on Up
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I started from the beginning and have moved up with each change.  Thank you Amazon.  The Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" is awesome.  Can hardly wait to see what is next.  Keep passing on the older versions to my family.  This time is was my daughter instead of my granddaughter.

Reviews.Title: Like it very much.
Reviews.Author: Warren
Reviews.Content: Had the regular kindle fire hd 8.9 and like it. however I wanted the front camera for pictures. Should have got the 64 gig for the storage. Maybe amazon will add a usb or memory slot someday.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable
Reviews.Author: fgski
Reviews.Content: Wanted a Kindle Fire when they were introduced, instead I got another table which was OK.  Picked up the Fire HDX and I am blown away with the display, the design (less weight) how easy it is to operate.  Great deal at the offered price.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Pauline
Reviews.Content: I love, love, love handheld computers, and was thrilled with an Android smart phone for a couple of years.  My eyesight is failing (the only thing worse than growing old is its opposite) so the Kindle Fire 7 was a great improvement.  Then I decided I would like something larger with a keyboard and print capable.  The Ipad Air was very attractive in a store, but the price and operating system made me hesitate.  Then I read a review comparing the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" to the Air, and was sold.  I love the extra size to make print larger.  An external keyboard did not work out for me, I need to hold the screen too close, and printing is still unexplored.  The young, sharp-eyed engineers decided that with the improved screen resolution they could decrease font size(!) of system text, like settings and messages.  Fie on them!  But web sites are easier to read.I tried the online help feature, and it is wonderful.  A helpful tech showed up in a postage stamp size window and we discussed my problem, I had accidentally turned on an awkward keyboard option, and she drew a red circle around the screen key to long press to turn off the option.  Great!Reading more closely about settings, I discovered I could turn off auto correct on keyboard entry.  That plus using a stylus makes writing on a Fire much easier.I am very pleased with this little computer.  I still need to find out about printing or maybe about storing files on line so I can access them from phone or Kindles.  I would be tempted by a larger one, too, within limits, but this one will do for some time.

Reviews.Title: Kindle = Happy Wife
Reviews.Author: Richard A Schauer "Jack Shadow"
Reviews.Content: A gift for wife. Great color, great sound. Books to read, movies to watch, music to listen to, games to play. She loves it. She is happy, I am happy.

Reviews.Title: A Birthday Gift
Reviews.Author: Txgranny
Reviews.Content: My family all gave me gift certificates or gift cards to Amazon.  They were combined and a Kindle Fire HDX was ordered on my birthday.  I have enjoyed it very much.  It is the first tablet form of computer that i have had.  If I wanted it as a way to rad ebooks, i think i would have liked a lighter-weight Kindle.  But this has so much more that you can do with it and it has been a pleasure to us.  It is like a toy for me.

Reviews.Title: excellent value
Reviews.Author: mormor
Reviews.Content: When my kindle fire first generation lost the ability to recharge the battery, I was trying to purchase a new battery.  When I talked to customer support, they told me I could not buy new batteries, but they had special prices on newer models in these situations.  I am very pleased.  Thank you, Amazon.  I did need to send back my old kindle fire.

Reviews.Title: My Favorite Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have had so much fun with this thing.  Lightweight. Plenty of power.  Was delivered so quickly (overnight), arrived in great shape and was working right out of the box once I hooked it up to my home server.  Now that I had it connected with AT&T; it works everywhere.  It was so worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Love my new Kindle!!
Reviews.Author: B. D. Beagles "bookbird"
Reviews.Content: I love this new 8.9" HDX Kindle.  I really don't know what I would do if I didn't have it!

Reviews.Title: A Birthday Gift
